text: Sent an email to inquire whether I can cancel or hold my card for the time being due to having some financial problem i have with my card, thinking that it was an issue that can be recognized due the the nature of my issue. Rather than getting help on it, all i got was that I have to make payment by QR code online before 1st January or i will have the late fees incurred if I don't. I even replied confirming the fact, and yet, was sent the same exact email about payment must be made before 1st January. On top of that, next year onwards, there would be an increment of $10 but there was no prompt of it at all and it is $10 more per what i signed a year ago. This is very unprofessional and it just seems like everyone is just out to get the comms, without having the retention. Very disappointed at the customer service provided by this outlet.

title: Anytime Fitness
name: M
text:
I have been visiting this gym often and like the environment but recently, I was approached by a personal trainer out of nowhere once I started resting during a workout. He was telling me about the evolt machine and benefits and kept being pushy. He kept asking me about my schedule and when I would come to the gym. He also assumed ‚Äúyou come when you feel like it?‚Äù before I could tell him when I would usually come to the gym. After a while, I was clearly not interested and told him that I‚Äôll try it out the following week. I also said I‚Äôm busy most days and I was trying to finish my workout quickly at the time but he kept asking me the specific days and timings I would show up to the gym. Throughout the conversation, he was being pushy, somewhat intimidating and very pressuring. It isn‚Äôt easy to workout alone as a woman and this interaction left a bad taste.

If I wanted to try out the evolt machine or wanted personal training, I would‚Äôve approached the staff myself. Did not feel comfortable after this interaction and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll show up often anymore.

text: I tried to call the outlet to ask regarding my C&C parcel to which 8 of it went to voicemail. So I decided to just head down to the store to ask personally. When i was there i did a refund as well but they fail to inform me that the refund will take about ‚Ä¶ working days. Previously when i did a refund, its always via cash and never cashless. So when i went home i realised that they didnt pass me back my cash and only handed me the receipt. I tried calling them multiple times again but NO responds AT ALL! I am very disappointed with causeway point Uniqlo‚Äôs customer service. I am also a customer and i should be treated the same way as the in store customers. I get that the store could be very busy at times but ignoring all of my phone calls is really unacceptable. PLEASE WORK ON YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!!

title: UNIQLO Causeway Point (Same Day Click & Collect)
name: Mia
text:
It has been a disappointing shopping experience for me today; A "Limited Offer" sign caused confusion. It was in the middle of two types of pants and it lead me to think that this offer spreads is for both of the pants. The sign was not specific that the offer would only be for a certain pant. So I chose a pant, spent time in the fitting room and queuing too, only for them to tell me that there was no discount. I had to go back to the place as I thought I had read wrongly but I realised that I would not be the only one who would be confused, as their placement of pants and that Limited Offer sign can cause confusion. After our feedback to the various staffs,  they tried to reach out to the manager who in the end, did not bother coming out and attending to us which I found irresponsible.
We are aware that regardless, there will be no compensation. However, we do hope that they make the shopping experience easier; shifting the pants accordingly.

text:

Nevertheless, I am still appreciative of the staff members trying their best to exchange for me. Really good customer service.

She went even further by going to get me a basket (on her own initiative) for the shirt and recommended some new items. 5 Star service. Thank you!

title: SHINING PC
name: Mike Zhao
text: Had a fantastic experience with Shining PC! Their response time was incredibly fast, and the customer service was top-notch‚Äîknowledgeable, friendly, and always willing to help. The product quality exceeded my expectations, and the delivery was surprisingly quick. It‚Äôs rare to find a shop that balances speed, service, and quality so well. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a hassle-free PC shopping experience!

title: SHINING PC
name: Tall Devil
text: He really help to diagnosed my pc as it wasn‚Äôt turning on. He even spots that something is wrong with my ram and helped to replace it. He fixed my pc less than an hour! Will come back soon if there‚Äôs anything wrong with my pc.

title: SHINING PC
name: Chris Gu
text: Went to this spot as the usual PC repair shop I go to closed down ages ago. Had my brother's PC diagnosed, repaired and even had some parts changed on the spot instead of having to wait for days to weeks. Very good service

title: SHINING PC
name: Bryan Ang
text: Had an issue with my computer not being able to boot up after self installation of my new GPU, and searched around to find this service. Charles was very in the know of PC building and repair as the issue was identified briefly and he offered solutions clearly and concisely without upselling at all. Overall really a hidden gem of a service located up north of Singapore. I had never written a Google review before even after being prompted by many establishments, but the experience and service is top notch to not recommend!

title: SHINING PC
name: Olivia
text:
I found Shining PC on Carousell. I had a CPU & GPU pair in mind (7800X3D + 4070Ti Super) and was open to recommendations for the rest of the build. I asked Charles for his recommendations based on what I would use the PC for, and he was very friendly and knowledgeable. He did not try to upsell me any components and even told me 4070TS is too much for my use case lol! He also answered my other questions patiently. Even though I texted him late at night, his replies were quick.

I paid a deposit a few hours later on Sunday morning (6 AM) and the PC was delivered the very next day on Monday. He gave me timely updates on the assembly, testing and delivery. He also helped to hook up the PC to my monitors and accessories to check if everything was good and if I had any questions.

I previously got a PC from the famous ‚ÄúA‚Äù brand and I must say the service is day and night. On top of that, the price given by Charles is very competitive (actually, it is even more affordable than the other few merchants I asked). I definitely recommend anyone looking for a custom PC to look for Shining PC. Enjoying my new PC as I type this review, thank you so much Charles. :)

title: SHINING PC
name: Patricia Werner
text: Amazing guy help me with everything can‚Äôt wait to build. Thank you

title: SHINING PC
name: Igneavour
text:
Came across this shop on carousell while looking for options and saw there was a lot of reviews. Did some more snooping around to make sure was credible as I had some doubts with such fantastic reviews but I am glad it was unfounded.

I have some background knowledge having built my own pc before but due to time constraints and life, decided to seek services to assemble all. So I was looking into the parts that boss recommended and I could see that he knows his stuff well. The guy was patient and quick in his response to answer my queries.

Finally, the time from confirming build to assembly to delivery was really fast, am grateful for delivering all the boxes as well promptly. Wasn't expecting him to offer to setup too and I knew how to so I thought it was fine. I didn't think he'd also have a video prepared in case so big ups for that! All in all, pretty satisfied from this purchase and I recommend!

title: SHINING PC
name: B Tham
text:
Outstanding service offered by an honest and patient proprietor - Charles. I've built and upgraded my own PCs in the last couple of decades and now with too much on my plate, decided to seek help after seeing their incredibly high feedback score on Carousell.
Since I'm already quite familiar with what needs to be done, Charles was very patient with my questions and demands, in upgrading my PC to exactly what I wanted. And this includes cloning my OS onto the new system (which is famously troublesome thanks to a certain OS software). He also offered good suggestions against my initial requirements which I verified and accepted.
Specific parts were obtained for my upgrade and to top it off, he fixed up my PC by the next day! My PC is rocking well in exactly the way I want it and I earnestly recommend their services to anyone who needs help with their PCs. üëçüëç

title: SHINING PC
name: Gilda Danish
text: The item is reasonable price.  It‚Äôs very cheap compare to the shop/seller.  And Charles is helpful,  friendly and he is knowledgeable.  He is very patient to explain all my query about my pc not only about the repair.   Legit & trusted seller.  Highly recommended üí™

title: SHINING PC
name: Stannis 882
text:
Charles was exceptionally helpful in diagnosing my pc that frequently BSOD, and lately when powered up no screen. He ran through couple of stress test and determined the problem is not my PC but probably one of my peripherals that is causing the issue. True enough. By process of elimination the problem was really my power strip which Charles did suggested for me to check.

And for all the trouble, he did not charge me any fee even when I insist on paying for his time.

Highly recommended for his expertise and honesty if anyone has hardware issues or need a new built for gaming or workstation.

title: SHINING PC

title: SHINING PC
name: Vance Chew
text:
I was researching on a new custom rig for fps games (valorant etc etc) as my old pre built was causing a lot of problems for me. I had very little knowledge about custom builds, but Charles was very patient and responsive to all my queries and I learnt a lot through the conversations we had, we even had a discussion that lasted a month regarding the specs of my custom build üòÇ. Finally after many messages on carousell and whatsapp i settled for this beautiful beast.

What I really like from Charles is that he is honest and transparent about what parts is necessary for the purpose of the PC and will not over offer things that you do not need, he is also patient and provides quick and easy to understand answers to all your questions. He also tailors to your needs for example, I was not very into the March Promo case that was used as default so he offered me many more options for my budget, these little steps shows how professional and niche he at his job.

Highly recommended to anyone looking to build a custom PC that will last for ages.üëçüëçüëç

text: Great store, Charles was patient and friendly, explained the whole issue with my PC and recommended appropriate parts to replace. The price was fair and service was fast. So hard to find store that do diagnostic and repair on the spot these days. Greatly recommended.

title: 313@somerset
name: Alan Tang
text:
Had lunch at Food Republic in 313 Mall. Saw a new stall ‚ÄúYuen Kee Dumplings‚Äù so we decided to give it a try.

There was a queue of 7 waiting to place their orders, while another maybe 5 other patrons waiting at the side for their meals to be prepared.

Got to place our orders after about 10 minutes, thereafter waited another 10 minutes for our orders to be ready.

We ordered their ‚Äúpopular‚Äù Shrimp & Crab Roe Wanton in Cantonese Style Soup. We were allowed to choose the type of soup or finishes (spicy, garlic, etc). $10.80.

Also the Chives & Pork Dumplings (like gyoza). For this we chose Viral Mixed Sauce with Chilli. $7.80.

The 10 Wantons were pretty big, wrapped with lots of shrimps and some crab roe, however I tasted like Ikura. The soup was clear and tasty. Overall quite good.

There were 9 pieces of Chives & Pork Dumplings in the other order. The sauce was something like chilli garlic sauce but not so heavy. They were sprinkled with peanut sauces. We found the flour wraps a little ‚Äúrough‚Äù; but tasted nice overall.

Prices were reasonable.

We finished our meal with our favorite Yuan Yang from the Toast Box Stall, next door.

The Food Republic on the upper floor is a food court that kinda resembles at local Hawker Food Center but with AC and more comfortable dining area. Its a walking distance from the hotels in the Orchard strip. Getting a taxi here is easy. You have the Ion Orchard Mall at the other side and the Somerset Mall on the opposite end.

If you‚Äôre looking for someone who is both knowledgeable and efficient, I highly recommend his service. It‚Äôs rare to find someone this reliable, and you‚Äôll be in good hands.

title: Paragon Shopping Centre
name: Angie
text: Was at Paragon yesterday evening between 6.30-7.30. Visited a Club 21 pop up sale store on level 2. The experience there with the so call salesperson wasn‚Äôt good. The store was selling most brands from Club 21 were slashing prices up to 70- 80 percent discount. I asked to reserved a pair of shoes in the afternoon and put at the counter as I need to rush off to meet clients. As a salesperson myself, this service given to me was below standard. Club 21 is a respectable company in Singapore having this young managers with no respect to customer is very bad. When I went back to buy the shoes, I couldn‚Äôt find it, so one lady brought out the shoes and told me it‚Äôs sales item, you asked my part time to keep for you she don‚Äôt know anything , if we sold the shoes away there is nothing we can do! This sentence , sounds rude to me. She looked down on customers that are buying sales item, if she can‚Äôt respect customers that are buying sales item, DON‚ÄôT GIVE DISCOUNT period.

title: Paragon Shopping Centre
name: joel chan
text: I'm usually quite hesitant to leave negative reviews but I hope this won't be the experience of others in the future. I was at Paragon today and really needed to charge my phone and when I walked past the concierge I noticed that they had a sign stating that they offer portable chargers. When I went up to ask if I could borrow or rent one, the lady at the concierge didn't even look at me until i paused to wait for her to look up and assumed she was busy even though she already said "hi" while looking down. She then told me I had to pay a $50 deposit to borrow the portable charger, which I am completely fine with and understand the need for. She appeared shocked when I said I was fine with the $50 deposit so I just said it again that I was completely fine with it. She continued staring at me and just said "$50 deposit" which honestly confused me because she didn't ask me how I wanted to pay and didn't tell me only cash was accepted and repeated it until I asked her if only cash payment was available. I then told her that i didn't have cash and asked if card payment was available to which she replied "there's an ATM"... I don't carry cash around and that's not her fault but I really think that for a mall like  paragon that the staff, especially at the concierge to have some sort of customer service training. I also think it would be a good idea to allow for card payment for the $50 deposit as many don't carry cash anymore especially if it is advertised at the concierge.

title: Paragon Shopping Centre
name: Sheng Sheng
text:
Paragon exudes sophistication from the moment you step in. Its interior design features airy dual atria, sleek wide corridors across six levels, and natural light flooding through clerestory windows all wrapped in warm timber tones and veined stone finishes. The space feels refined yet inviting, balancing luxury with a welcoming atmosphere.

This is a premier destination for upscale fashion and designer labels. Inside, you‚Äôll find an enviable collection of international luxury brands like Gucci (home to a five-storey flagship), Prada, Givenchy, Burberry as well as accessible luxury names such as Coach and Miu Miu. The mix caters to a wide range of shoppers, offering depth without sacrificing prestige.

Paragon also shines when it comes to food, offering everything from casual caf√©s to fine dining. Highlights include Michelin-starred Crystal Jade Golden Palace and the luxurious Imperial Treasure Super Peking Duck restaurant.

If you‚Äôre looking for a luxe yet approachable shopping experience in Singapore, Paragon delivers on multiple fronts: beautiful architecture, top-tier brand selection, diverse dining, and great accessibility. Whether you‚Äôre browsing high fashion or stopping for a gourmet meal, it‚Äôs a stylish and elevated destination that impresses.

title: Healthmark Family Clinic
name: Viv Goh
text:
Dr Adrian is amazing! Truly empathetic, meticulous, humorous and assuring. A doctor who warrants a re-visit without hesitation.

However, there is huge room for improvement at the counter. We were on time for appointment,  waited 10 minutes and was attended to Dr Adrian promptly. Next, was a 20-minute wait for medicine and the clinic was empty. I am an advocate of respect towards service staff and I believe this should be mutual when handling patients. We checked in every 10-minute intervals because my elderly mother is feeling unwell. For the first check, Nurse Stella who was busy, told me to take a seat and that her colleagues would attend to me when it is ready. We didn‚Äôt hear anything after 10 minutes. Before we knew it, there was a patient who walked in to purchase medicine off the shelf and he was attended to promptly by another nurse. After he collected his medicine and made his payment, we were still waiting to be called. When we checked on status again, nurse Stella got visibly irritated, spoke louder and told us that the medicine had to be reviewed by the doctor. Then, she nudged her colleague to speed up and commented loudly ‚Äúfaster, patient asked and asked‚Äù. It was as if it was deliberate. When her colleague finally ended the call, I realised the main holdup was because the name labels had yet to be pasted on the prescribed medicine. It reflects absolute inefficiency and also disrespect for patients‚Äô time. I would have understood if they were busy and explained why they needed more time. But, what I could not appreciate, was the lacklustre attitude demonstrated at the counter.

title: Healthmark Family Clinic
name: val
text:
TRULY A SICKENING AND REVOLTING EXPERIENCE

I was feeling extremely unwell as a suspected case of covid so I trudged myself to the nearest clinic (about 15 minutes walk) around my area. Went into the clinic at around 8pm feeling really sick and was told that they are fully booked, and I would need to book an appointment to see the doctor and I do understand that they might be short staffed. My vision was getting really blurry due to high fever from covid so I asked questions like whether they could recommend me a nearby clinic where I can get myself checked and some medicine as well.

However, instead of speaking nicely, one of the clinic assistants (short haired chinese lady) "chased me" out of the clinic and kept cutting me short. Told me that I should go and google it myself and pointed to the door while telling me to leave the clinic. Terrible service staff. Do not recommend. Don't bother performing your job if you're just going to be super rude towards patients who really needed some assistance. Ended up going to another clinic on another 15 minutes walk away where the service staff were really nice and helpful (and whereby I was tested covid positive by the way.) Please do not go to this clinic unless you intend to be treated badly by their service staff.

text: Was quite empty when I was here (usually weekday lunchtimes are quite crowded), food was delicious and rather affordable (caviar, new Zealand ribeye and truffle oil pasta for $22.90). Only downside was that there were quite a few flies flying around our table while we were eating.

title: Greenhouse Bistro
name: XY Sim
text: A nice cosy bistro offering quality western, Asian and Japanese cuisine at affordable prices. It‚Äôs a little far and tucked away in the western side of Singapore, but well worth the money. Perfect for a team lunch getaway if you‚Äôre working in the west.

title: Greenhouse Bistro
name: Dusko Grba
text: Food is just fantastic n great value for money. Lamb chops n Steak were tender, Fish with chips tasted really fresh n like real fishüòÉ. Their coconunt n vanila shakes are kinda cheap but very creamy n super tasty. Location is in the middle of Tuas industrial estate n u can reach it only by car as it is bit out of the way. Highly recomend and me n family will be back!. Thank you to all the staff!

title: Greenhouse Bistro
name: ikalicia Grba
text: Although we've lived in Boon Lay over 7years, this was our first time to visit this place. Food and service exceeds our expectations. Happy to return again next time! Good work crews!

title: Greenhouse Bistro
name: Shelley Chang
text: Great food with great variety of selection. It is best to make a reservation for weekend lunch as it's very crowded.

title: Greenhouse Bistro
name: Wz Chan
text:
Food was delicious. Place is definitely a gathering spot to drink.
Pasta aglio olio was delicious. Nasi Ayam was very good.

title: Greenhouse Bistro
name: Trancemaster
text:
This is probably one of the most westerly restaurants (the other being the one at Raffles Marina near the second link) in Singapore. Located in Tuas West, this restaurant is located in a 'ulu' industrial flat, amongst factories and industrial buildings.
The Place:
The hugh dining hall was decorated with many posters of food and LED wordings on the walls, which, together with the plastic plants, seem somewhat crowded and tacky. The bar counter was too crowded with equipments and utensils, and was overshadowed by the large posters hanging over it. The decor could improve with a better interior designer.
The Food
I had the truffles olio aglio pasta with New Zealand ribeye. The pasta was perfectly cooked, with a nice degree of al-dente. The truffles oil add a hint of umami to the olive oil-based sauce, without overpowering it. The ribeye was a bit tough, probably due to the lack of marbling of the New Zealand steak, but was well cooked and not dry, attesting to the skill and care of the chef. The addition of black cavier on the steak, although did not add to the flavour, however did enhance the presentation of the dish. The restaurant was having a promotion of Japanese oysters - $1 for each raw oyster. The plump oyster tasted full of briny freshness, and was creamy in textual.
Conclusion
It is worth a visit if you are around the area.

title: Greenhouse Bistro
name: Benedict Correya
text:
Greenhouse Bistro is a charming and cozy dining destination tucked away at 30 Tuas Bay Drive, offering a refreshing escape from the industrial surroundings of Tuas. It is well-known for its relaxed atmosphere, spacious setting, and greenery-inspired decor, making it a welcoming place for both casual diners and those looking to host small gatherings like company lunches, team celebrations, or birthday parties.

The bistro prides itself on serving a diverse menu, combining both Western and Asian cuisines, ensuring that there‚Äôs something for everyone. Diners can expect a good selection of dishes, including pasta, grilled meats, local favorites, and fusion creations. The food is well-prepared and served in generous portions, making it a satisfying meal experience.

One of the standout features of Greenhouse Bistro is its comfortable and airy ambiance. The seating is well-spaced, and the greenery-themed decor gives the space a relaxing, garden-like vibe, which is quite rare in the Tuas area. It‚Äôs a perfect spot to unwind after a long day at work or simply enjoy a leisurely lunch with friends or colleagues.

In addition to dine-in services, Greenhouse Bistro also offers islandwide delivery and self-pickup options, making it convenient for those who prefer to enjoy their meals from home or the office. Customers have praised their efficient service and the consistent quality of their food, whether dining in or ordering for delivery.

Overall, Greenhouse Bistro is a hidden gem in Tuas. It offers not only delicious food but also a peaceful and inviting setting, making it an ideal choice for anyone in the area looking for a comfortable place to enjoy a good meal. Whether you‚Äôre visiting for a quick lunch, a group gathering, or ordering in, Greenhouse Bistro delivers a satisfying dining experience.

title: Homeground Gym
name: Elijah Lim
text: Homeground Gym Jurong West is exactly what this neighborhood needed! As soon as you walk in, you feel the welcoming community vibe ‚Äì it‚Äôs not just a gym, it‚Äôs a place where everyone genuinely wants to help you reach your goals. The equipment is top-notch, and they have everything from strength machines to cardio gear, all brand new and well-maintained. I love that it‚Äôs science-based and data-driven, so I know my workouts are backed by research. The personal trainers here are awesome ‚Äì super knowledgeable and really focus on sustainable progress rather than quick fixes. Plus, the live occupancy feature is a game-changer, letting me plan my workouts around busy times. Can‚Äôt recommend it enough for anyone looking for a serious, results-oriented gym experience in Jurong West!

title: UNIQLO
name: Serene Lai
text:
I purchased during the SG60 promotion, so I spent $60 thinking I would receive a $6 voucher. However, I ended up getting nothing, as you mentioned my item was a pre-order item. In order to qualify for the $6 voucher, I had to choose the "Click and Collect" option at the Lot 1 Uniqlo outlet.

When I later received your email stating that the item could not be collected during the promotion period, I decided to change the Click and Collect option to home delivery instead. However, the Uniqlo staff did not allow this change. This kind of inflexibility made me very frustrated, and in the end, I received nothing from this promotion.

If I had known it would be like this, I would not have joined this Uniqlo promotion at all. I am extremely disappointed.

text: This was my 1st time coming here and I was a bit lost at the counter. I do not know how the machine payment works but one of the female staff members approached me and helped me through everything. Really nice enough to assist me for the payment machine and overall it‚Äôs a great service.

title: UNIQLO
name: Rudy Sayas
text:
I ordered a pair of jeans and a shirt online for a company dinner and the app suggested size 40 for the jeans. Unfortunately, that size was too big and I went down to Jurong Point store to make an exchange the following day.

Truthfully, I was dissatisfied with the way the Supervisor there handled this issue.  He did not seem keen to provide the necessary assistance.

He checked for a while but informed me that the system wasn't updated and that there wasn't much he could do. Is it my problem that the system was not updated?

I do realize that he could have approached or made a call to other management for assistance but he failed. I asked if there was any other way for me to make an exchange and he informed me he could help to check with the other stores except that I have to travel to that particular store for the exchange but he didn't make the call. I could not believe it as I knew that some outlets would provide inter-store transfers upon request.

He also suggested exchanging for other items which I was not keen on.

Since he could not provide a further solution to this issue, I left the store but returned to him shortly as I wasn't satisfied with his ‚Äúdon't care‚Äù attitude. I showed him that the online has available pieces but he kept telling me his system was not updated.

Eventually, to avoid further dissatisfaction, I left the store feeling annoyed and furious. I know he could do something but he chose not to.

Finally, I managed to obtain the exchange from other outlets. A bad experience from this outlet.

Put in 2 stars because one of the staff at the cashier rendered his assistance before calling the supervisor to step in.

name: Dylan Ng
text:
I transferred my AF from AF Jurong Point to AF Nanyang back in 2023. The treatment in AF Nanyang is totally difference compared to AF Jurong point.

When I first had my slipped disc in AF Jurong Point, my case and responsibility on my membership was simply pushed around, ended up I found out my membership which was sign up for 12 months became 18 months simply because they wanted to clock sales.

When I shared my troubles and my encounter with AF Nanyang, they kindly assisted me and assured that this would not happened in AF Nanyang.

I simply love this place and the people there. Such a pity that my slipped disc had worsen which left me no choice to stop my membership.

Love AF Nanyang, great job and keep going.

text:
Started gymming at this branch many years ago. Over the years, they have tried their best to revamp and kept up with time.
Their staff were very friendly, really treated the users like friends and family. They even provide phone charging cables, bananas and sweets regularly for users.
This is a stark contrast to the staff and ambience at other AF branches in the vicinity. Keep up the good work!

title: Anytime Fitness

title: Anytime Fitness
name: Saufi Aiqy
text:
Checked out Boon Lay Anytime Fitness for the first time and I‚Äôve got to say ‚Äî I‚Äôm really impressed! The gym has pretty much everything you need. Loads of machines, a wide range of equipment, and the free weights go all the way up to 50kg. The best part? They actually have two pairs of each dumbbell, so no need to fight over weights with anyone. Plenty of benches too, so you‚Äôre not stuck waiting around.

Big shoutout to Wandi at the front desk ‚Äî super friendly and helpful! He made me feel really welcome on my first visit. Give that guy a pay raise!

The gym is clean and well-maintained, with four toilets/showers so it‚Äôs easy to freshen up after your workout. There‚Äôs even a vending machine with protein shakes, which is a lifesaver if you forget to bring yours.

All in all, awesome vibe, solid equipment, and great service. Definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the Boon Lay area!

title: Anytime Fitness
name: RH
text:
The cleanliness of the gym‚Äôs toilets could definitely use some attention. Additionally, the management needs to focus on enforcing gym rules consistently to ensure fairness among all users. For instance, despite the gym‚Äôs policy requiring proper attire, I‚Äôve noticed several instances where members were either barefoot or wearing slippers, which raises safety concerns.

To add to that, just yesterday, I saw someone using the treadmill shirtless. This not only poses a hygiene issue‚Äîwith sweat potentially spreading onto the equipment‚Äîbut also creates an uncomfortable environment. What‚Äôs more concerning is that this happened while a staff member was present, yet no action was taken. It leaves me wondering what the staff is actually doing during their shifts and how they‚Äôre ensuring a safe and hygienic experience for everyone. There‚Äôs definitely room for improvement in these areas.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Hirotaka Sato
text:
Dr. Ferguson provides thorough explanations, ensuring that patients fully understand their treatment options. His procedures are precise and efficient, demonstrating a high level of expertise. Additionally, he takes his responsibilities seriously, showing a strong sense of professionalism and dedication to patient care.

Ms. Nurul, dental assistant, is also very attentive and professional, working seamlessly with Dr. Ferguson to ensure smooth and efficient treatments. Furthermore, the clinic manages appointments well, accommodating scheduling requests and ensuring a smooth booking process.

Thanks to both of them, I can enjoy my meals comfortably without any pain or concerns about my teeth. I truly hope they will continue to take care of my dental health in the future.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Pietro Miglierini
text: A great clinic. Can't complain.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: oii jar xii
text: Dr ferguson helped me w wisdom tooth extraction and he was really really nice and patient :) the receptionists are also really sweet, surgery was smooth and quick

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Y X
text: Highly recommend Dr. Ferguson for his professionalism. He takes the time to explain dental procedures and concepts with great clarity and, when necessary, shows research papers. Thanks to him, I have maintained good oral health through years of visits.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Jingge Xiao
text: Dr. Elizabeth at FC Dental is very professional and patient. After a quick examination, she pinpointed the problem with my teeth and proposed a scientific step-by-step treatment plan. I feel very lucky to have met a doctor like her.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: ÈòøË´æArnold
text: I just don‚Äôt understand why the internal staffs never align info together. I need to go back and forth to ask and the staffs‚Äô attitude were all terrible. The process was totally a mess too.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: ZE ZHANG
text:
Dr. Mok who works every Wednesday is really irresponsible.

40 days ago I paid a very high price to have a tooth fixed. After about 40 days, the filling developed a problem and it hurt when I drank cold water. So, I suspect that the material has fallen out, but of course, it could be something else, so I want to go for a review. Dr. Mok said she would remove the previous material and replace it with one that was temporary and did not guarantee results. I expressed my concern because once the medication failed, my teeth would be exposed and more damage would be done. Then,  after I refused to use this material, I asked if I could use the original material and Dr. Mok refused. So I decided not to change because, after all, no one wants to revert to a temporary, less good-looking material without taking that much risk. Dr. Mok went on to say that if I were to leave, she would have to take a photograph of my teeth to prove that there was nothing wrong with her fillings. I thought this was utterly ridiculous. If she was so adamant that there was no problem, why did she change me to a bad material in the first place? If I don't change the material, do I have to prove that her padding is fine? I felt that she was simply shirking her responsibility. She would not allow me to leave if I refused to have my photo taken because the case had to be documented. High charges + bad attitude + shirking responsibility make me very unhappy and I hope someone will pay attention to this matter.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Yuechen Jiang
text: Over charging and waiting for long hour

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Ying Wang
text:
Today I went back to Dr Mok for tooth cleaning. As usual, Dr Mok is professional and gentle. I knew her in Nov, 2020, when I went to have the wisdom tooth removed. There was an extreme pain due to the pressure induced from the wisdom tooth. I expressed my suffer to the young lady in the counter, after a short check, she decided to let me in during the Dr‚Äôs break time. After x-ray, Dr Mok discussed the condition of the two visible wisdom teeth with me. Then everything went through smoothly. Blood stopped hours later. Quick recovery (2~3 days) and no pain after removing one wisdom tooth. One week later, I went for a bite wing x-ray to check risk of cavities (one-time check valid for 3 years) and had normal tooth cleaning.
The service is excellent, though the price is a little high (even with student discount). But Dr Mok and her assistant can be trusted!

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Abby Ammad
text: Today at 4 pm I went for consulting a pain headache resulting from tooth decay after got 2 X-ray was done. Don't know why the dentist recommended scaling and cleaning but never do the filing of my decay tooth. At night I can't sleep because of toothache. He should know which to piority first. I paid $219 for the service. Next morning I had to go another dentist. Very frustrated.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: TK Chen
text:
Terrible service!
They need two months to make a crown that typically takes two weeks!
Impressioned for the first time and was told a few days later that need to take another impression. No reason explained.
They keep rescheduling my appointment for a single treatment. Was rescheduled many times just for a crown treatment, including a last-minute change.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Ke Wang
text: The orthodontics treatment by Dr. Mok is truly a nice experience for me. She is very professional in designing the treatment plan. Every time doing the adjustment, she not only checks the teeth condition carefully,¬† but also listens patiently to my feelings and request for teeth and adjusts the treatment accordingly. She always thinks for the patients, and recommend the most suitable, and economic choice for me. I actually spent a quite reasonable price for the entire treatment. The results turn out to be good. I am satisficed with the teeth now and have cultivate good teeth caring habits. Thanks so much to Dr. Mok.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Jun Wang
text: Dr Ng is very experienced, nice and kind. I'm grateful to have her diagnosis and treatment.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: YONGXIN WU
text: Many thinks to Dr NG and Sher Pei. I suffered from serious toothache recently due to the wisdom tooth. It caused a terrible swollen face and pain of my left face. I even could not sleep these days and felt extremely painful. It is Sher Pei, helpful and nice, who helped me make appointments and recommended me to Dr NG. For Dr NG, she is very experienced,kind and warm and she gave me lots of encouragement! With her professional help, I feel much more better right now.I am so lucky and grateful to meet them in Fullerton Dental in NTU.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Pei Leng Tan
text: Went for my wisdom teeth extractions and I must say it had been a really pleasant experience. My extractions involved both extractions and surgeries which my dentist, Dr Ng did it smoothly. She assured me many times during the process which calmed a first timer like me alot. And I must say overall she did it so well and stitched the wounds such that i did not experience much pain post-extractions which I'm really grateful for. An amazing experience, would recommend NTU students/staffs to go to ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Andr√©s Granados del √Åguila
text: I am a patient at this dental clinic from the last 5 years or so. If I have last this long it is because I have been always assisted by Dr. Mock. She is highly professional. She always take great care of explaining things very carefully. This is very useful for one to understand what is the situation one is facing. Knowing well the situation helps you a lot a when taking an important decision. She works with great dedication and has a strong commitment to quality. Because of all these reasons and my confidence on her, I decided to face a few serious and complicated treatments, like surgical implants, happily, all successful. I am very satisfied with Dr. Mock and I believe I will continue working with her. The negative side is that perhaps the costs at the clinic are high. It would be great if Fullerton Dental would revisit their prices. It is true that the clinical instrumentation is quite advance, but still...

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Hyejeong Ahn
text: Dr Ferguson at Fullerton Dental @ NTU is the kindest and most thorough dentist that I have ever encountered. He is always concerned of my wellbeing during the treatments. I could really relax during my root cannel treatment. Seriously he is the best. The receptionist Sher Pie is also very professional and kind.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Antoni Gil
text:
I went to Fullerton Dental clinic at NTU more than 1 year ago and I always felt very good treated, specially by Dr Mok and Dr Ng.
Maybe they charge a bit more than other clinics, but in may case I prefer a very good job than a cheap one: I already experienced that cheap becomes expensive at the very end, I lost 3 tooth due to cheap treatments
In addition, I have to say Dr Mok is really gentle on treat and during her practice, always being professional and honest with all the solutions she proposed regarding my medical treatment

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Iskandar Shah
text: Visited the clinic for the first time due to bleeding gums and suspected tooth decay. Dr Mok attended to me and did a thorough check, including x-ray. She explained to me the condition of my teeth, with the x-ray images and the sort of treatment required and the number of times required. It was detailed enough and I knew the breakdown of cost after my initial visit. Everything went well and my gums are in much better condition now. Thank you, Dr Mok. See you soon.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: su Boyi
text:
I had just completed my orthodontics under Dr. Mok. She was always careful and patient. The experience was great.

Before the orthodontics, I was suggested to have deep teeth scaling. My gum was seriously swollen and teeth were shaky. The doctor said that it would be harmful to wear the braces with serious gum problems. I thought the advice was reasonable so I took the treatments. Can't deny that the price was a bit high, but it worth considering the service and results. My gums became healthier and were ready for the latter process.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Nick Aplin
text: It is always a pleasant experience to receive treatment from Dr Mok. She provides absolutely painless treatment. Her professional manner is excellent and she always rises to the combined challenge of providing expert application of both technical and social skills. I have been a regular patient during the past 3 - 4 years, with some tricky surgery to experience. There has never been a call to question the decision making. Dr Mok is considerate and articulate in her approach to providing an excellent service. Highly recommended.

title: Fullerton Dental
name: Âº†Ëµü
text:
I would not recommend anyone to go to this clinic. Had mild gums problems and the doctor (Dr. Mok) exaggerated them and asked me to do four sessions to finish up teeth scaling. I paid 400 dollars for the first visit and decided to cancel the rest of the appointments. It is a rip-off and I wonder why a dental clinic on the campus would only care about profit rather than the well-being of patients. I then went to another clinic and had completely different experience. The doctor told me that my gums problems are not serious at all and only advised to go back for another check in one month. Most important, I was only charged 150 dollars for the treatment! So if you must go to the campus clinic, avoid Dr Mok (she is on duty on Wednesdays). I hope she is the only one like this in the clinic. Otherwise, shame on the clinic!

A follow-up: So I gave them the benefit of doubt after they told me that they saw my review and listened to the doctor's explanations, albeit belated, for the fees and her rationale for the arrangement of the treatment. She claims that she did not my email that I sent her earlier enquiring why so many sessions were needed. Although it seems really odd that the email (which I sent through my NTU work email address) did not go to her gmail, let's just believe it is a technical problem. She also explains to me why she did not refer me to a specialist during the first visit because she thought she could handle it. All in all, she tried to explain everything to me, and yet I am not quite fully convinced to be honest. I just wish that the communication could have been done earlier and more effectively. I also hope that doctors could be more cautious and thoughtful when providing their medical advice in the future. And I encourage those who are going to seek dental service to speak for their needs and communicate immediately whenever you have doubts.
On another note, I appreciate their good attitude and desire to communicate with me.

The place is also extremely kids friendly, they have lots of child seat, kids utensils and also scissors are provided.

The place is also halal certified, suitable for our Muslim friends.

text:
The food here has seen improvement and only got tastier, compared to the time this outlet first started. This has shown that the restaurant took pride in delivering quality products and service, by going great lengths to read and listen to feedbacks from customers.

However what made the dining experience exceptional was the exceptional service Zaim rendered. He‚Äôs 100% an invaluable staff - never fails to put on a smile whenever interacting customers, greets incoming and outgoing customers, thanking them for their support when leaving, very respectful, attentive to diners needs and remained courteous throughout

During the lull period - he will be seen keeping the counter and tables clean and tidy, while doing so he would periodically turn to check if any customers would require his attention, check on the equipments functionality etc.

All I could say is that Zaim does not realise his true potential in what he could deliver and I sincerely hope his employer or his future employer could help him see it. Well done!!

Service and ambiance are good.

title: Lemongrass
name: A
text:
My family and I have dined at this Thai restaurant three times over the span of two years. Our first experience was genuinely enjoyable ‚Äî the dishes were flavorful and left us wanting to return.

However, on our second and third visits, the quality noticeably declined. We ordered similar items each time: the spicy lemongrass lime fish, tofu with spinach, and Tom Yum (chicken or seafood). Unfortunately, after both recent visits, all of us developed severe sore throats, which may suggest a heavy use of MSG.

Beyond that, the flavors didn‚Äôt feel as authentic as we had hoped. The balance of spices and ingredients seemed off, and the overall experience left us disappointed.

While we appreciated our initial meal here, the inconsistency and potential health concerns have made us reluctant to return. Sadly, I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll be coming back.

text: Very2 sedap. I took the ribeye fried rice which is 14.80 and it was worth it.  A lot of food choice which most of which are Thai and fusion. If don‚Äôt want individual meal or with family u can buy sets such as a huge sea bass  set, Tom yam and much more. Quite tasty and delicious for its rather fair price. Ate here multiple times bc very sedap. Also, the service is good. U just need to scan a QR code then can order if u have trouble the waiters can help. The waiters and chefs also cook quite fast like abt 10-20 mins and the food reaches fast. The atmosphere here is really relaxing bc not much ppl go here and peak hours it‚Äôs not as much as other restaurants prob bc it‚Äôs in the heartlands. Would recommend u to try!

title: Lemongrass
name: E N
text: Have been here a few times. Staff are friendly and helpful. Food is okay - nothing particular to rave about. The mango sticky rice is a bit of a hit or miss - sometimes the mango is sour , sometimes it is sweet. Was quite disappointed to find out that their coconut water is from a tetrapak (excessively sweet) and the flesh that was added in was also from a very old coconut. Quite disappointing considering it‚Äôs meant to be a Thai restaurant - authentic coconut water is a basic. Cmon guys you can do better!

title: Anytime Fitness
name: Shane Raja
text:
Extremely Disappointed with the Staff and Management at Anytime Fitness Tampines Mart

I‚Äôve never experienced such poor customer service at a gym until I signed up here. From the very beginning, the Malay male staff who handled my registration was rude, dismissive, and seemed completely uninterested in assisting. It already felt like I was being judged just for being there.

When I tried to request a respectful termination of my membership, I was met with even worse treatment over the phone. Rara, another Malay staff member, was condescending, disrespectful, and completely lacking in basic courtesy. The way she spoke was offensive, and the attitude she displayed made it very clear that the gym has zero regard for customer service‚Äîespecially if you‚Äôre not who they want to treat well.

What‚Äôs even more disappointing is how obvious it is that this gym treats people based on how they look. If you‚Äôre conventionally attractive, you‚Äôre treated with smiles and attention. If not, you‚Äôre talked down to like you don‚Äôt matter.

Even Virgin Active, a far more premium gym, didn‚Äôt treat me like this when I chose not to renew my membership. They handled it with professionalism, respect, and class‚Äîsomething this outlet clearly lacks.

Avoid this place. The management needs serious retraining, and the staff culture‚Äîespecially those mentioned‚Äîneeds to be re-evaluated. This gym is giving the Anytime Fitness brand a bad reputation.

title: Tongue Tip Lanzhou Beef Noodle ËàåÂ∞ñÂ∞ñ (Downtown East)
name: Clarence Ow
text:
This is definitely a must try noodle shop. There are 8 type of noodle cut to choose from, ranging from very thin to fat and broad.

Whats even better, you can refill your noodles unlimitedly if your order a large portion. The refilled noodles can be of any noodle cut. If you are a big eater, you definitely have the chance to try all 8 of them.

If both of you are small eaters and decided to share a big bowl, you can also refill but refill one time only.

I personally like the dry version and the chilli taste great. While the noodle came with soup, you may also separate the noodle from the soup with another bowl and season the sauce yourself using their given chilli and vinegar. Try until you got your perfect proportion.

Definitely will be back. And try their plum juice again.

Their service will make your day and make you feel really happy and treasured that you made the choice to dine with them! I must compliment their good service and work ethics! Top notch service for a restaurant.

They are also very kind. An elderly entered the store and they accommodated to their needs despite a full service and only 2 front staff. Fantastic work!

title: White Restaurant (Waterway Point)
name: Isaac Lee
text:
I visited White Restaurant at Waterway Point on 23 Aug 2025 and was truly impressed by the excellent service from Ms Ng Pek Lian. She was extremely patient and polite throughout, always serving with a genuine smile even though the restaurant was very busy.

What stood out most was her sincerity, she took the time to recommend dishes, advised us not to over-order since we only had four people, and made sure we felt comfortable. Despite having to walk extra rounds for customers, she never once showed frustration or a grumpy face.

Her warmth and attentiveness made the dining experience feel homely, and her constant smile really brightened up our day. Staff like Ms Ng make a huge difference, and we truly appreciate her service.

title: Lau Wang Claypot Delights @ Punggol Oasis Terraces
name: ç…æ…¥
text:
My 4th Lauwang outlet visit ‚Äî Prev Serangoon Central, Tampines 1, Bugis+.

Punggol Oasis's outlet is conveniently located just beside Oasis Punggol LRT stn (East Bound, 2 stops from Punggol Central). On the first storey.

I felt the consistency of the food across Tampines 1, Bugis & Punggol Oasis is pretty much the same (which is good).

However, the service here was just.. fine. It wasn't really peak dining hours. But initially I was waiting to be served a table. So I was in the queue. But wasn't attended to. So I had to walk in & get myself a table as the customer infront was just in the way.

I also find the luo han guo beverage at this outlet a little sweeter. As compared to Bugis+ 's.

After ordering the food & payment online, less than 6-7 mins, the food arrived. Impeccable speed.

title: The Punggol Settlement
name: Nur Iman Rostam
text:
The Punggol Settlement is a row of food establishment that lined the coastline of Punggol's Northern region of Punggol Coast. Amidst the towering HDB BTOs nearby, this venue is the best place to unwind after a long day of work and just chill. The best part is it is close to SIT Campus of Punggol Coast and Punggol Coast MRT. Buses 84G and 84W serve this area.

Head to their 7-Eleven Convenience Store and get the Wall's Vanilla Choux Puff at the Ice Cream coolers and double it down while sitting at one of the promenade's open-air public seating. The choux Puff is chewy and the vanilla ice cream interior burst with flavours.

title: The Punggol Settlement
name: PC
text: There are a variety of food options there, chinese food, seafood restaurant, BBQ, and a bar. We went there during Saturday night and it was super crowded. Luckily we managed to find a parking space amidst the limited lots. We chose the House of White Bee Hoon restaurant and the service was terrible. The restaurant could not handle the number of orders and missed our table. They only served us drinks, 2 dishes and stopped. We have to keep reminding them about our order and in the end it took 30mins. The indoor & outdoor dining makes no difference as the aircon is equivalent to non-existent. It will be the first & last time for us.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Ting Wei Tee
text:
I‚Äôve visited Whisk & Paddle a few times and every dish I‚Äôve tried has been consistently great! The mac and cheese is a must-try ‚Äî rich, creamy, and surprisingly good. I also recently tried their cream cheese garlic bread, and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back just for that.

What I love most is the location ‚Äî it‚Äôs right next to the park connector, so it‚Äôs the perfect spot to chill and have brunch after a morning run.

The only small downside is the indoor temperature. The staff mentioned they leave the glass door open because of people coming in and out, but I couldn‚Äôt quite understand the purpose of having a glass door then ‚Äî isn‚Äôt it meant to help keep the cool air inside? It did make the indoor area feel a little warm during my visit.

Still, it‚Äôs one of my favourite brunch spots, and I highly recommend it!

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Sook Fern Heng
text:
Kid‚Äôs friendly, nice song & environment and good food. Brunch, lunch & dinner favourite place ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
Normal meal is about $20-$30, if adding in drinks and desserts, it will be about $30-$40.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Javier Loke„Ç∏„Çß„Éì„Ç®„É´„É≠„ÇØ
text: Had the lamb shank while my dad had the pork ribs both were delicious and appealing, the garlic cheese ring was superb. The staff were attentive and prompt, service was great.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: JooZoo WG
text:
Is my second time here after a long time. The place is spacious and cozy. Ordered the dry laksa pasta that is for the SG60.

The sauce is alittle too thick and creamy especially when I was still waiting for my friend food to arrived. And it is little more salty. If it gets cold the saltiness is more obvious. Not sure it my problem, but I cannot feel it is laksa enough, something missing.

Overall, to try something new, is not too bad, but maybe the chef can cook it alittle less salty.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Yun Yi Thiam
text:
Nice place, nice vibes, mediocre food but expensive! ($50/pax)

Food looked promising, but what we ordered felt and taste average for the price. Portions were decent, but flavours lacked that extra oomph. Not bad, but not particularly memorable either.

Still a good place for a chill brunch.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Don Lim
text: The oysters were not cold although the shells and plate were full of ice. We assume it would taste fresher and slightly tastier if it is so. The tacos were stuck together with the beef, cheese and some salsa. It was a mess and very hard to consume while we had to seperate each bite with so much difficulty and trouble. It would be better if the beef, cheese and salsa were given individually with the same generous portions. The tacos were so crispy but the combination made it hard to eat and made the tacos soggy. The soup was full of seafood umami and the beef was the highlight of the day. Perfectly medium rare and the meat melted in your mouth. A very example of the chef's grilling skills brought to the heights of culinary. Highly recommended for beef lovers!

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Norman Gerard Teng
text: Dinner was great. We had a seat near the bar and service was very quick. Photos are with my wife...

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Chan Chan
text:
Stopped by Whisk and Paddle around 8 PM after a cycling session with my brother. We ordered two Sapporo Lager pints (500ml each at $12). Drinks took about 10 minutes to arrive, and the service was friendly and smooth. Used PayWave with no issues.

Atmosphere was great. It wasn't crowded at that hour, and we got to sit outside where it was calm and relaxing. There was even a live band opposite singing Mandarin songs, which added a nice touch to the evening.

Pet-friendly too. Saw a few people dining outdoors with their dogs, which was nice to see.

Overall a chill spot with good vibes and solid service. On the pricier side, but I‚Äôd recommend it for a casual night out or to unwind after a long day.

Why couldn‚Äôt help people to be convenient?

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: Tricia Lam
text:
I would like to raise a concern regarding my helper‚Äôs experience at your clinic this morning, 27 June 2025.

My helper arrived at the clinic at 7:40 AM, ahead of your opening time at 8:30 AM, in preparation for her scheduled medical checkup. However, once the clinic opened, she was rejected for the checkup and was told she would need to return on Sunday instead.

When my helper called to inform me, she was told the reason for the rejection was that the male doctor on duty could not perform a blood draw for her, and that a female doctor would only be available on Sunday. I found this explanation puzzling, so I called the clinic myself for clarification.

Despite my attempts to understand the situation, I was only told again that the male doctor cannot take her blood, with no valid explanation provided. I even asked whether the doctor was a trainee (which could explain certain limitations), but was told he was not. I also asked whether a nurse could perform the blood draw, and was informed that the clinic does not have a nurse.

I find this situation extremely frustrating. My helper waited nearly an hour outside the clinic, only to be turned away and asked to return two days later. This feels both inefficient and inconsiderate, especially since no prior notice was given about the limitations of your staff or service.

I would appreciate it if someone could explain why this happened, and more importantly, advise where I can escalate this feedback so that other patients do not face similar experiences in the future.

Thank you for your attention, and I hope to receive a proper explanation soon.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: SENTHILKUMAR J
text: Docto Response good üíØ Chong Skin Ein

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: SAMITA PEY
text: Extremely disappointed with the experience at this clinic. I was queueing outside for almost an hour, carrying my very sick son the entire time, waiting for them to open. When I finally got in, the staff informed me that the replacement doctor on duty does not see children under 4 years old. There was no notice or information posted outside to inform patients about this, which could have easily prevented all this unnecessary waiting and stress, especially for a parent with a sick child. Very poor communication and absolutely unacceptable.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: khaingzar aung
text:
Waiting time is too long. More than two hours to see doctor. Never open their announcing time. Doctor never reach right time. Consultation time is short period a few min only. Please respect timing and patients. Most of the patients are really sick.
Staffs never serve seats for patients. 3 or 4 persons only can sit inside of the clinic.
Doctor and staffs are OK. My point of view is waiting time and seats.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: sansan gan
text: Waiting time quite long, impatient staff and doctor even didn't check for skin sick then issued medicine. Doctor used to issue a lot of medicines and collect the high cost compared to other clinics due to the same sick.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: KA Fankabelle
text:
My family and I have been visiting this clinic for years. We understand that the waiting time is long but we were ok with it, as long as we are able to get treated. The doctors are generally nice, patient and thorough when we consult them. The counter staff were ok in general. However, my recent experience in this clinic was disappointing. The counter staff was extremely rude and impatience. I politely asked a question about collection of medication (we waited for at least 20-30 mins already but still not called upon to collect) but received the following unpleasant responses:
- Wait... Can you wait? Wait for few minutes... Just wait...
- I am very busy. You just have to wait... Doctor still need to XXX
- Doctor, can you XXX, the patients are complaining already
We understand that the counter staff may be busy (by the way there are 2 counter staff). As patients/family members, we do not want to make things difficult for the staff. What we wanted from the counter staff was that our responses to be answered politely, and be respected. I sat inside the clinic and observed that this counter lady, for every question that patients asked, her responses would be very hostile and rude, and unpleasant. One patient claimed that he was asked to come down to the clinic at 10.30am, but this counter rudely responded "No, I did not said that (x2)". The patient left the clinic, probably feeling why he was treated that unpleasant way when he was already sick.

All in all, doctors are good, but the system in terms of registration and medication collection needs to be improved. What is more important is, the counter staff (working on 26 Dec morning), needs to work the way she responds to patients. If every patients that asked you a question and you need to be so reactive, defensive, hostile and rude, then the problem lies with herself. She is busy, the clinic is busy, but so are we. Please give us the respect that patients deserve when we visit the clinic.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: Salwa Halid
text: Registered at 8:30am but the doctor is not in till close to 9:30am and the first queue number haven‚Äôt even been called. The worst clinic ever. If doctor cannot come early, then say clinic open at 9:30am.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: Yunn
text:
Admittedly, the wait time is long.
I waited about 1.5h from queue number 60 to 65. My consult was pretty short as it was just a minor sickness, but some queue numbers took a very long while.
And I think that does signify that the doctor is thorough. The locum I saw was pleasant and kind.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: Ashlynn Loo
text: Not sure why the low rating for this clinic but I have the best medical care from Dr Chong Seik Ein. My 2yo daughter had HFMD and we needed to give her some medical attention on Sunday night, and not many clinics were opened then. Rushed over to see Dr Chong and she was very detailed in her assessment and advice to us parents on what to look out for and how we could help alleviate her discomfort. The medication she gave also worked very well for my daughter. Highly recommended!!

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: Jessie Chong
text: Saw Doc Joanne this evening.  She is so patient and details when helping my daughter with the small lump on her ears. Her cheerful tone helps to relax my nervous gal.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre

text: Â•≥ÂåªÁîüÂæàÂ•Ωüëç

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: Tay Carina
text:
This clinic better close lo, my mother is there around 10plus in the morning, and she is having fever and feel giddy and the nurse told my mother the clinic is closed. They don't accept anymore patients,  elderly who is sick and alone and cannot travel to another clinic. What should they do?

I called up the clinic and the nurse told me they have already accepted the numbers of patients for the morning session.

It so amazing, first time i hear from clinic they still got number of patients to meet per session. The nurse just simply want to knock off on time at 2pm.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: Quinn Schmidt
text: My daughter had the pleasure of being treated by Dr. Chong Seik Ein at Pioneer Medical Centre, and I couldn't be more impressed. Dr. Chong combines extensive medical knowledge with a compassionate approach, making every visit both informative and comfortable. Her attention to detail and dedication to patient care are evident in every interaction. The entire staff at the centre is also courteous and professional, contributing to a positive overall experience.  Saw many reviews regarding the long waiting time, I felt that it was worth the wait. A good doctor can make the illness feel half cured, and Dr. Chong embodies this philosophy perfectly. Waiting at A&E is even longer unless for emergency cases. I highly recommend Dr. Chong for anyone seeking top-notch medical care.

title: Pioneer Medical Centre
name: XinJie Tan
text:

This is my third time visiting this clinic. This is close to my home, so I come back here. Except for the doctor's diagnosis, everything else is very bad. The last two times I came, many people had to wait at least 2-3 hours to register. Even after seeing the doctor and waiting to get medicine, they had to wait at least 20-30 minutes. Alas, if you need to wait for a long time, you can inform the patient in advance. Today I came to see a doctor. There were only three people waiting, but I still waited for more than an hour before it was my turn to see a doctor. It's really ridiculously slow and a waste of time. Inefficient. If it wasn't close to my home and the sick leave was reasonable, I wouldn't come back.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Faiza Khan
text: Good find! It‚Äôs very homey and gives such a good feel. I liked their food as well. Very few or barely no tourists. Only locals. They have free face painting for kids too for a few hrs during the morning. And free sunglasses for kids when they order a kids meal. However there is no lake or water view it‚Äôs all blocked by vegetation. So if you‚Äôre going for the view there is none. But still  nice place. They have toys for little babies too and they can play while adults eat.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Davide Mollica
text:
While the service during our visit was fine, I unfortunately experienced severe gastroenteritis shortly after the meal. I strongly suspect the issue originated from the mushroom bruschetta, which appeared off in taste and texture. Out of the four pieces served, I consumed three, as my family did not enjoy them, and I felt compelled to finish the plate.

By the following Monday, I had no appetite, suffered diarrhea over 20 times throughout the day, and experienced severe vomiting (7 times). I even fainted twice due to dehydration and weakness. The vomit clearly contained undigested pieces of the mushroom bruschetta. In addition, the pizza we ordered was undercooked in the center, which further raises concerns about kitchen safety standards that evening.

I am not attaching photos or medical documents to this message, but I will gladly provide all necessary evidence and medical reports if needed for further investigation.

Please take this seriously and look into what may have gone wrong with the food preparation that evening. Food safety should always be a top priority, and I hope appropriate actions will be taken to prevent this from happening to others.

Looking forward to your response.

Sincerely,

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: claire
text:
Visited with a group of 9 and had a really disappointing experience. There were many empty tables, but none that could accommodate our group size ‚Äî so we ended up waiting for a table in a restaurant that wasn‚Äôt even full.

One of the available tables had finished meals with personal belongings left behind, but the family was nowhere in sight ‚Äî they were clearly done eating and had gone to queue for a face painting event organised by the restaurant. We asked the manager if we could be seated there or if he could help move the unattended items so we could sit down.

He refused, saying there‚Äôs no time limit for diners and nothing could be done. Instead, he just told us to keep waiting, without giving any idea of when the family would return. Meanwhile, he stood from a distance, watching us and appearing smug and indifferent, offering no further help.

The lack of professionalism, flexibility, and basic courtesy was really disappointing ‚Äî especially since this place used to be much better. Sadly, it‚Äôs not somewhere I‚Äôd return to or recommend after this experience.

title: Whisk & Paddle
name: Glenn Chia
text: Decent food, brunch style, mostly with some interesting choices, child-friendly and comes equipped with a small play area and for the day, a balloon artist. Great atmosphere with a few photo op built-in

title: Whisk & Paddle

text: Nice and quiet place to enjoy lunch.

title: Whisk & Paddle

text: Went on a Saturday afternoon without a reservation. There were plenty of indoor seats and we got a table right away. The food was surprisingly good, way better than I expected and better than I remembered from years ago. The service was super fast and the staff were really friendly and attentive. Only thing is the matcha latte could use a bit more matcha because I couldn‚Äôt really taste it. Overall, a nice place with tasty food. I‚Äôll definitely come back again!

text:
Me and my partner saw the positive reviews of this place and decided to try it on two separate occasions as we live in the vicinity. During our first visit, we bought a double scoop ice cream cone, with dark chocolate and speculous flavours. I felt their dark chocolate flavour was rich and enjoyable and its texture was alright. However, we couldn't say the same for the speculoos that had a rough texture and seemed to be breaking apart in clumps.

On our second visit, we tried the molten lava cake set with chrysanthemum flavoured ice cream. My wife found this flavour too sweet to her liking and we weren't too impressed with the pre-made molten lava cake. It was decent but we wouldn't rave over it.

title: Eutopia Cafe | Acai Forest

name: Kevin Ho

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: P S Ang
text: do not be in healthcare industry if you lack basic empathy. Counter staff in her 30s were extremely rude, shouted at my elderly grandma. We spend money to see doctor because we are ill, not to be scolded. Come at your own risk.

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: yannicious
text:
I was told by one of the clinic assistant at 615pm that the doctor would be available at 7pm, with my turn likely around 8-830pm. This is frustrating, as if the clinic had answered my call earlier and issued a queue number, I could have gone home to have dinner, shower, and return on time. Instead, I had no choice but to wait at the clinic, as going home would have been too rushed and risked missing my turn.

I attempted to purchase medication but was met with unhelpful and poorly trained auntie staff who was unable to advise me on suitable options based on my prescription history. The lack of professionalism and competence from the clinic assistants is deeply disappointing.

I have decided not to return to this clinic and will lodge a formal complaint with the MOH and inform the area MP. Patients deserve better service and proper training for clinic staff to avoid such inconveniences.

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: Irene D
text:
If you‚Äôre looking for poor diagnosis, wasted time, and rude customer service, this clinic is the place to go.

I had the unfortunate experience of visiting this clinic twice in 2024, both times being consulted by Dr. Goh.

1.	August 2024 ‚Äì I sprained my thumb, and the pain extended to my wrist. I explained that I couldn‚Äôt move my thumb, and my wrist was in significant pain. Dr. Goh briefly examined my wrist and simply stated that it was sprained. He prescribed ointment, but the pain worsened over the next week. I later visited a polyclinic where the doctor provided a more thorough assessment, diagnosing a nerve injury in my wrist that required a steroid injection. After being referred to a hospital and receiving the injection, I recovered fully within three days.

2.	September 2024 ‚Äì I experienced heavy menstrual bleeding for two weeks. Dr. Goh advised me to take Norethisterone for 20 days to stop the flow. When I asked if it was necessary to take it for so many days, he insisted it was. He also added that I should take high blood pressure pills, despite me telling him I don‚Äôt have high blood pressure. He tested my blood pressure three times and insisted it was abnormal. I explained that I‚Äôve had low blood pressure most of my life and that the elevated reading might be due to panic after bleeding excessively. He refused to reconsider, claiming that high blood pressure pills would reduce the bleeding. When I tested my blood pressure at home, it was normal.

3.	Patient Privacy Concerns ‚Äì There‚Äôs absolutely no regard for patient privacy in this clinic. Two of the counter staff (packing medication and collecting payments) are respectful, speaking softly when dealing with patients‚Äô personal information. However, the two seated behind the counter never get up and instead shout out patients‚Äô full names, NRIC numbers, house addresses, and phone numbers for everyone to hear. During both of my visits, I witnessed them shouting at elderly patients. On one occasion, an elderly man mentioned it was his first time at the clinic, and the staff loudly responded, ‚ÄúWhy must you come here?‚Äù I also saw a middle-aged woman buying medication without her physical NRIC. Instead of proper verification, the seated staff simply asked her to recite her NRIC number and proceeded to sell the medication. Isn‚Äôt this dangerous? Why isn‚Äôt there a proper process in place? People come to the clinic unwell ‚Äì the least they deserve is respectful treatment.

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: Ayna NaJu
text: They have the worst clinic assistance. All the new faces are super rude

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: faustina koh
text: Suspected dengue last monday but dr goh dismissed me and refused to address it. Prescribed me antibiotics which to i had an adverse reaction to - stomach was in intense pain. Had to go back to dr tay last wed to get meds for my stomach.. went to poly clinic on saturday due to rashes appearing. It has been a week and not surprised that it turned out i had dengue. Dr Goh not only diagnoised me incorrectly.. he even prescribed me meds that i didn't need which caused a whole new issue.. disappointing

Do not recommend coming if there's emergencies.

The staff perviously told me that I can come an hour later when I called at 730 for a blood test. I went down and the staff was really rude to me and said I cannot take at this timing. What's more is that I came down twice early morning and they rejected me. Really bad stuff service.

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: Goh Baybay
text: Dr LingÊòØ‰∏Ä‰ΩçÂæàÊ£íÁöÑÂåªÁîüÔºå‰∏çËøá‰ªñÁöÑÂëòÂ∑•ÊúçÂä°ÊÄÅÂ∫¶ÂæàÂ∑ÆÔºåÂæàÊ≤°Á§ºË≤åÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çÊòØDr LingÂåªÊúØÈ´òÊòéÔºåÊàë‰∏ç‰ºöÂéªËøôÈó¥ËØäÊâÄ„ÄÇÂëòÂ∑•ÁöÑÊÄÅÂ∫¶ÈúÄË¶ÅÂüπËÆ≠„ÄÇÁ≠âÂ•π‰ª¨ÊãøËçØÊØîÁúãÂåªÁîüËøò‰πÖ„ÄÇ

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: tamagoyaki V
text:
I dare say this clinic's handling covid the best out of the 4 clinics in the area.

They actually had signs out to tell patients when the queue is full (I highly recommend putting Chinese / Malay / Tamil signs too, at the side of the counter facing out to the door. Might help elderly patients and foreign workers who do not know English). This is already a world of difference from another clinic I shall not name, which I waited at for 30 mins yesterday only to be told to head over to the next door clinic and wait for 2.5H, because I'm not company sponsored. (They didn't even put a sign, srsly. Half the queue were not company sponsored.)

They also had special signs for people who self-tested ART positive too. Unlike yet another clinic in the area I shall not name, which claimed to do Swab tests online but turned me away in person saying 'no swab test here', APEX is legit. They understood the need when I told them I'm ART positive. They accommodated me when I asked if I could be given a queue no. for couple of hours later, despite the queue being full. Sure their phone line may be down, but their in-person service definitely benefits from that.

Service-wise, the staff were most efficient and polite, and I'm really thankful to Dr Tay, who cracked a joke when she saw how sombre I was about getting covid. The brave lady did not even bulk when I pulled down my mask, despite my fear of transmitting Covid to her. Kudos to her!

If there is one complain I do have, it would be the signage out at the front. It's good that APEX gets along so well with the Universal Dental Group that they even share similar letter fonts, but at first, I didn't dare go in thinking I might end up strapping myself in for a teeth drilling session. Now's not the time for sure, but in the future, when Covid does lighten up, hopefully the clinic will consider rebranding with different letter fonts, if not add an Upstairs and Downstairs Arrow logo alongside the different establishments.

title: Apex Medical Centre Pte Ltd
name: Jen Jia Ying
text: Dr Ling is a doctor who genuinely cares about his patients. He is a doctor that my family trust and seek advice from when we are ill. We highly respect him for his skills and expertises. Thank you for being such kind and compassionate doctor. And I appreciate the counter staff for staying professional despite the overwhelming amount of patients and stress. Hope you all and your loved ones stay safe and well. Side note: I'm currently recovering well from digestive issues after my visit to Apex Clinic and NTFGH.

title: University Health Service
