text:
Absolutely the worst health center in SG!!! Came at 7:40am to do the health screening and went out at 12:15pm, with another test rearranged at next week. Totally unacceptable!

The nurses at the blood test room are crazily rude and offensive, seems they never learn how to respect patients/customers. They often yell at waiting people with really impatient tone.

Low efficiency and worst service is this place!üò°

title: University Health Service
name: Halloren Chen
text: The malay female staffs are very rude and inpolite! Jez, still cant believe they r employees in such prestige uni.

title: University Health Service
name: Shantanu Kumar
text:
Magnificently ill managed.
Asked us to come at 4.30 pm for collecting reports. The queue was there since 4.30. Nobody bothered checking or initiating the process. At 5.30, the girl came out to take the receipt/collection papers. People were sweating outside. Finally we got to go inside at 5.50 pm.

Okay frustration aside, if the centre is low on resources they should stop testing at 4 and start the process of giving out reports. They should look at way to manage the crowd as well. Nobody likes waiting without any information.

title: University Health Service
name: Lo'vyn Lai
text:
Payment:
Message from NIE said that the complusory health screening is free. However, before any screening is done, I was asked to pay $55. The staff said that they had informed NIE about the miscommunication. Payment cannot be made by VISA as their machine is down.

Procedure:
Before the health screening, we had to print out a form to fill in physically. It's quite long, detailing not just our personal medical details but also our family's medical history. During the screening, the nurse fill in another form with the test results. After that, we were ushered to a tablet station to key in everything again digitally, rendering all the hard copies redundant. The digital form is 15 pages long, and the touchscreen is not sensitive, so it took a very long time to key in those information that took a very long time to complete on hardcopy in the first place.

Privacy:
The waiting room for X-ray consists of 2 rows of chairs placed facing each other and in uncomfortably close distance. (Note that females are required to remove their bras and wear only plain T-shirts.) There's a curtain to separate the waiting room from the rest of the clinic, but once we're called for the X-ray, we'll have to go out. (Ladies, you might want to go with a jacket to cover yourself.)

Staff:
The only redeeming factor I guess is the staff. From the receptionists, to the doctors and nurses, everyone is very patient and friendly. üëç

title: University Health Service
name: Luca Vismara
text:
After 3 phone calls and 2 visits over 2 days I finally found a time where the expected waiting is less than 2h. Please provide some tables so people can work and study in the meanwhile.

Pro tip: take the campus rider (green bus) to Pioneer polyclinic. Still covered by NTU basic student insurance.

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Judy Tan
text:
My home gym. I‚Äôd go around to try out the other AF gyms with high ratings since I signed up end of last year. Feels like the ratings of some of them are solicited but oh well.

This one is deserving though. Everyone in there are like friends and really welcoming. I bumped into Amirah near my home couple of weeks after I signed up and she called out to me by name. Like how did she even remember my name even if she remembered my face after such a short period of time?

The gym is clean, users are mostly friendly and willing to rotate/share equipments. Love that the gym equipments are well maintained.

Male and female bathrooms are separated (rare for Anytime Fitness gyms).

I‚Äôm so relieved this is my home gym. Phew.

text:
Love the ambience at this gym. It‚Äôs a safe space and welcoming place  for gym goers , with top notch equipment and wonderful staff.

It‚Äôs a pretty spacious gym with quite a big variety of machines that you don‚Äôt usually find in other AF gyms.   Place is generally neat and equipment are well maintained. Nice to see that they provide each equipment with sanitizer spray and wipe down towel.

The higher ceiling and natural light from the many surrounding windows add on to the feeling of spaciousness and good energy at this gym.

Very friendly and welcoming staff at the gym too!

The only unfortunate recent development happening ,  the mall is under renovation and reconfiguration, leading to a relocation of nearest escalator further away as well as shrinkage of free space / stretching area.

I also appreciated that when I wanted to cancel, they didn‚Äôt pressure me to stay, which says a lot about their professionalism. The changing rooms are always tidy and clean. The only minor downside is that they sometimes reply late, but everything else is great.  üòä

I would say this is more of a powerlifting gym (discouraged for regular gym-goers). The lifters here often ‚Äúhog‚Äù the racks, come in big groups, and take LONG rest times. Properly wouldn‚Äôt visit this gym again.

Staff here are friendly though! :)

Bumi brings an unparalleled level of energy and positivity that motivates both staff and members. Shah's commitment to ensuring a smooth operation is evident in his reliability and attention to detail. Ari's knowledge and willingness to go above and beyond have been key to our success. Amirah‚Äôs warmth and attentiveness make everyone feel welcome, while Allyssya‚Äôs organizational skills and cheerful demeanor have been invaluable. Lastly, Ana‚Äôs proactive approach and infectious enthusiasm have left a lasting impression.

Keep up the incredible work!

title: University Health Service
name: Stacey Chan
text:
I tried to have my health screening at UHS on a Monday morning (9.30am) but it was horrendously crowded. I have to get a queue number JUST to have myself registered, don't even talk about having myself being checked by the doctor. After realising there's 20 persons in front my queue and waited for 20 minutes, I decided to do my health screening at a private clinic.

I thought I would have avoided the long waiting time and poor customer service at UHS. Little did I know that I will have to bring my health screening report down to UHS for endorsement! God knows how long I will have to wait AGAIN just to get my report endorsed! And they insist that I will need to pay $5 for endorsement! Seems like you cannot avoid paying to UHS by any means!

Do I need to mention that no one ever picks up my call during office hour? I call at 10.30am, no on picked up. I call again at 11.30am, again no one picked up. I called on a Thursday morning by the way. It shows how understaffed the place is.

The other comments really aren't kidding. I registered at 11.30am and was called only at 3pm, to which I said I would not attend the consultation, as I had already left hours ago.

Though, I must say that it felt very luxurious for a clinic, with a spacious, naturally lit waiting room accompanied with soothing classical music and even pop art on display.

Still, I only give it 1 star for being a case study on why healthcare should be privatised.

text:

title: One Medical Clinic
name: WT
text:
I came to One Medical Clinic after seeing 2 other GPs for my condition.

I found Dr Loke to be the most patient, caring, and skillful GP out of the 3. He really spends time to understand each condition, patients' concerns, and to share his knowledge and advice on health matters. He was also the only doctor whom I felt comfortable having my blood drawn by (unfortunately many GPs are just not good at finding veins).

Because of Dr Loke's thoroughness and him being the preferred doctor of many, it is common for the queue to be 1 hour long. It's usually fine to step away for a while after taking the queue number.

I consulted Dr Loke regularly from early 2021 till end 2023 when I moved house. The receptionists were kind and nice to me. Those who say they are snappy should remember this phrase "do unto others as you would have them do unto you". After visiting other GPs after I moved house, I also realized that One Medical Clinic's receptionists were the most efficient ones.

text: The doc is pretty good but the reception is by far the worst I‚Äôve encountered‚Ä¶the two ladies are terribly rude .. do they think they are doctors???

title: One Medical Clinic
name: Ben
text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting One Medical Clinic and felt compelled to share my outstanding experience. From the moment I walked in, the atmosphere was warm, welcoming, and efficient.

The reception staff was friendly and efficient, making the check-in process a breeze. The waiting area was clean, comfortable, and well-organized, which helped alleviate any initial concerns.

Dr. Loke himself provided exceptional care. His expertise, professionalism, and genuine concern for my well-being were evident throughout the appointment. He took the time to listen attentively to my concerns, thoroughly explained diagnoses and treatment options, and made me feel comfortable asking questions.

Moreover, the clinic's facilities were modern and well-maintained, contributing to an overall positive experience. The entire team, from the administrative staff to the medical professionals, demonstrated a commitment to patient care that truly set them apart.

I highly recommend One Medical Clinic for anyone seeking a reliable and compassionate general practitioner. My experience was nothing short of excellent, and I am grateful to have found a healthcare provider that prioritizes both the physical and emotional well-being of their patients.

Thank you to the entire team for the exceptional service.

title: One Medical Clinic

When I arrived at 910am, I was told there were no more slots for company card visit, and the next available slots would be at 5 pm with the unwelcome reply from the reception. title: The Crowded Bowl
name: anonymous
text: Really disappointed with my recent visits. The service staff literally count out the ingredients, exactly 5 pieces of each item, like they‚Äôre rationing food. Prices have gone up but the portions have shrunk, and it‚Äôs nowhere near as filling compared to just a year ago. If you‚Äôre going to call yourself Crowded Bowl, at least make sure the bowl actually feels crowded. Right now it‚Äôs the opposite. Service attitude also leaves much to be desired. Definitely not worth it anymore.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Wong
text: This was my second visit, and I came back because I had a great first experience. I arrived around 7pm this time, and many of the dishes were already sold out. Unfortunately, the food didn‚Äôt taste as fresh as before, likely because it had been sitting out for a while. I also forgot that this is a vegetarian spot, and personally found the mock meat and tofu a bit too processed for my liking. The price is v affordable though

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: lfl
text: Food is not nice, seems unsanitary when just left out in the open. Service staff is rude, not explaining the difference in sizes and what we can choose from. Not recommended.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Seah Jia Hui
text: Fml the price increase like no tomorrow. Inflation rate 10%‚Ä¶ few years ago, it was $4.5 for small bowl, now it‚Äôs $4.9. The staffs here are also not very generous with their portion. Lunch time queue waiting time can get up to 30mins. Take away add $0.3. I would recommend to just get the eat in bowl if you are going to seat somewhere near northspine.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Anything 4 Food
text:
Food is good, but experience got drastically affected by the rude service staffs. I fundamentally believe if you don't like your job you should either quit or do something about it and not vent it on the business's customers. Either the owners is oblivious to the situation or the staffs are putting up a front.

Staff wasnt patient at all when we asked about the ingredients displayed as there were no descriptions and it's our virgin visit. Asked for napkins if possible upon checkout and all 3 front staff quickly jumped on aggressively to say don't have, saw tissues at the cashier counter and asked if I could have one if not I could buy it and they said that's kitchen towels and not tissues so no. After seating down heard the staff complaining among themselves of how they haven't had their off days. I guess they are overwhelmed as they were are seating inside the counter on a toilet stool when we walked in. The place was empty tho with only 1 table of 2pax.

Food was good and super value for money as recommended by a fellow alumni. I personally feel it's underpriced for the quality.

To the owners I hope you're seeing this as you have a great business given your NTU story, and it will be a waste if you lose customers over stupid unnecessary things like this. Super great fast service business model with exceptional prices and the last key to the lock is to have basic decent human to human respect from the service staffs. We are not even talking about any customer service here.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Lisa K
text: Drove all the way here on a sat coz our friends were raving this place. When we enter only one customer. 3 serving staff. The lady with specs seem like she had a bad day. As it was my first time here she seem impatient and sounded like she want to end work asap lol when i ask her about the menu and where to choose etc. Food was normal nothing special. Not much variety as well. Not worth the travel lol! The service make it worst and im not stepping foot in anymore. Regrets! :( my sat brunch~

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Irina Kartseva
text: Eating every day here - best food, great quality, affordable pricesüôèüèª‚ù§Ô∏è

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: winniethepooh
text: The service was poor, and the portion size served by the young girl at NTU Gaia was disappointingly miserable. It was clear she wasn‚Äôt putting in much effort, and if she‚Äôs not happy working there, she should just quit.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: L N
text:
Very affordable and healthy lunch -  Regular bowl of 1 main with 3 dishes. I chose 4 dishes instead because I wanna skip the carbs. There was a variety of sides, ranging from vegetables and mock meats. I chose broccoli, cucumber, corn and add on with scrambled eggs. The portion was generous and the vegetables were well sauced.

I‚Äôd definitely return for lunch another day.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: JR L
text: Found a piece of rubber band in the food. Taste was ok, but 30 cents for takeaway which does not include a plastic bag is steep

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Cassia A
text:
Not a bad healthy option. It says $4.90 on the board + $0.30 for takeaway, and mine was $6.90. Not sure where that price came from.
The vegetables taste fresh. The lettuce is just romain so nothing too substantial. The rice is a bit oily.
The tofu was good but there wasn‚Äôt much of it added.
You choose a few sides and a main. The base is salad and rice or pasta. I think that‚Äôs how it works‚Ä¶
No credit but they take cash.

If you‚Äôre looking for a healthy option on campus with lots of vegetables, try the Yong Tau Foo in south spine (fine foods).

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: DK
text: Value for money, good taste

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Swetha Shanmugavel
text: Came here regularly when I was a student. Got the large bowl this time around with a friend to share. Good for trying out all the ingredients. However, I'd recommend getting a smaller bowl as the flavours are more concentrated!

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Mecha Griffin
text:
The food was fulfilling and tasty. Their portion sizes are perfect for me, I can eat a normal cai fan 3 ingredients and feel satisfied so their normal bowl is just enough. My favourite ingredients are the mock fish, corn and one other veggie or meat depending on what I feel like. I'm not going to dock points, but there are some ingredients I feel are pretty rough and just don't fit in terms of flavour and texture, like the fishcake looking tofu has a grainy feel and is almost flavourless. Other than that, choose between savoury or sweet and sour sauces to complete your bowl. Oh, and their scrambled egg is top notch, extremely creamy, soft and fluffy if you're an egg fan.

I dined in, and the experience was OK. Not too cold or hot, sometimes I guess one or two flies will make their way in due to the lack of a strong air-conditioning curtain? So one star off.

Service is excellent, staff is friendly, attentive and quick.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: yammy l
text:
the place is not rly hygienic, there are many flies flying around and some even landing on the food. can't eat swatting a fly away every 5 seconds. not even exaggerating.

food is nice but I'm worried about getting food poisoning. really disappointed with their cleanliness :(

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: Melvina Chen
text:
Food is ok but service is too slow.
Only one person taking orders, refilling food, and doing cashier when there are 10 people queueing up during lunch hours. Many people end up walk away instead.

title: The Crowded Bowl
name: tsuki
text: $4.80. One of the healthier options at NTU North Spine. The vegetables taste fresh. The fusilli is not too hard and not too soft. üëçüèº

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: James L
text: Friendly and hard working üëç

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Jack
text:
This is not my home club as it's not near where I stay or work, but having visited it for the first time last week I wished this was my home gym!
The layout is great, so many different machines that I do not see in other AF, especially back machines. There's a nice view from the 2nd floor. And best part is, lots of sports outlet stores here to get your latest workout gear!

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Ng Qi Xuan Olivia (Sacss)
text: the person at the counter was rude saying I was underage and I can‚Äôt have the free trail

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: jordan fong
text: J n Rayn, always giving a very warm welcome to every af members, looking forward to gym here often

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Muzammil Peer
text:
I've been a member of Anytime Fitness CCP for a while now, and it has truly been a fantastic experience. The gym boasts a vast space with well-thought-out equipment placement, ensuring plenty of room to work out comfortably. The ambience is great, making it a conducive environment for all gym-goers.

The amenities are top-notch, and the toilets are always fully stocked. However, it would be even better if there were at least one more toilet facility in the gents. ü§£

I must highlight the exceptional service provided by Shah, the most brilliant staff member at Anytime Fitness CCP. Shah is incredibly helpful and makes everyone feel right at home. He takes immense pride in his work, ensuring that no issue goes unnoticed. His dedication to providing the best experience for gym-goers is truly commendable. Shah's attention to detail and willingness to go above and beyond make him a standout asset to the gym.

Overall, Anytime Fitness CCP offers a wonderful gym experience, and Shah's outstanding service is the cherry on top. Highly recommended!

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Donovan Choo
text: Changi City Point is hands down one of the top gyms in Singapore with the environment and the people. One of the more commendable staff is Jay, he is a very friendly Physical Trainer at the gym that is always helping others and welcoming us to the gym. He also has a large clientele of clients which also adds to his repertoire of skills and training principals. Someone I look forward to seeing in the gym constantly.

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Shan Chen
text: Gym is becoming very crowded and noisy!

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Ian Tan Wee
text:
This review is especially dedicated to one of the staff at Changi City Point AF, Jun Long. Respectable and Professional young individual, from being able to welcome members of this wonderful gym or more so I should say a family. One being such that he is able to make me feel like home in this gym. Another special quality of him, would be being able to guide me through a workout. Able to demonstrate certain movements in various exercises with precision, checking my form and range of motion for me to execute the movement correctly. With such quality of teaching, I am able to stray away from any sort of unnecessary injuries due to bad form.

Thank you Tan Jun Long, you have really make a deep impact on my life. I would highly recommend him to anybody in the gym, who needs a trainer !

title: Anytime Fitness Changi
name: Gab ‚Äúgift_of_the_gab‚Äù
text: I‚Äôve been a regular at CCP AF and one thing that I really appreciate at the gym is the very welcoming staff, specifically Jay. Jay was very welcoming whenever I was in the gym. As I was usually in the gym by myself, he would often come up to talk to me which made me feel a lot more comfortable and even encouraged me to push myself further in my workouts (I even set a few PRs because of his encouragement). He is always willing to help my friends and I with exercises that he had learnt and also shows concern when we haven‚Äôt been to the gym in a while. This is one of the reasons I choose to stick with this AF even though it isn‚Äôt the closest outlet to where I live.

So far the best and most authentic Korean delights inside the campus.

Service is good ‚Äî the aunties are welcoming. The chicken bibimbap and the spicy chicken soup are highly recommended. I usually buy either one of these. Fried chicken is also gd if you‚Äôre looking for snacks. Plus one point for the clean environment.

title: Waterway Point
name: Bernard Tan
text: Lots of shops. There is no need to head to town

title: Waterway Point
name: Crumpled Nomad
text:
Waterway Point has always been one of those malls that feels both spacious and lively at the same time. Located right next to Punggol Waterway Park, it‚Äôs got that rare combination of shopping convenience and scenic vibes ‚Äî you can literally finish a coffee and be strolling by the water in under five minutes.

The mall itself is bright, airy, and well laid out, with a good mix of retail, dining, and lifestyle options. Whether you‚Äôre here for groceries, a quick meal, or a movie, everything is within easy reach. Dining choices range from casual cafes to family restaurants, and there‚Äôs even a decent variety of dessert spots for that after-meal treat. I especially like how there are plenty of seating areas, making it easy to take a breather between shops.

What‚Äôs really nice is the way Waterway Point integrates with its surroundings ‚Äî the outdoor boardwalk and park connectors make it feel less like a concrete mall and more like part of the community. On weekends, you‚Äôll see families with kids playing in the open areas, joggers passing through, and couples taking in the riverside sunset.

All in all, it‚Äôs not just a shopping destination but a place to unwind, hang out, and enjoy the Punggol waterfront. Whether you‚Äôre here to shop, eat, or just soak in the relaxing atmosphere, Waterway Point delivers a complete day-out experience.

title: Waterway Point

text: generous portions!! but toppings are a bit on the salty side

text: I will forever love Crowded Bowl! Such hearty and healthy salad every time. As a plant based exchange student, I have struggled to find filling and healthy meals on campus to which Crowded Bowl satisfies both cravings without breaking the bank. Also bring your own container if you frequently get takeaway to save on plastic usage. I usually go around 3pm for a late lunch to avoid the crowd if that helps. Definitely give Crowded Bowl a shot!

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: Yizheng Lin
text: A fail safe place to go. Friendly and attentive staff. I like their new menu as it suits me better. Food is excellent, love the drink choices as well. Prices are reasonable. tried many items on their menu, always consistently good. Hidden gem in changi!

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: Jimmy Chew
text: Had the oxtail stew. The meat was soft and the stew goes well with the baguette. I think the stew is not saltish enough otherwise all goes down well with a Suntory draft.

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: Mun Chong
text:
There's room enough only for one table of 5 in aircon area.
We sat outside luckily today's weather was quite cool.
German pork knuckle was clearly a highlight; came with mustard, chilli paste, apple sauce, black pepper sauce, and a serving of bread (baguette slices). Will order again. German pork knuckle is this standard is hard to come by although not all pieces of crackling were chewable, but this was probably the exception about one or two pieces. Most of the crackling were truly delectable. Meat did not taste as if it had been parboiled before roasting. Sauerkraut mildly sour. Order this first - takes 30 min at least before you continue with the other orders. Best to tell them to serve dishes together otherwise one or the other may be pretty filled up with the other dishes and waiting for this to be served.
Oxtail stew pretty well-flavoured 2 large pieces, quite meaty and came with a serving of rice.
Shepherd's pie - pretty good taste, portion for one.
Pork collar was pretty good, had bite and not tough. Whole baked potato.
We shared dishes trying to give everyone each a taste of everything.
Attentive and cheerful service.
Will be back, nice homely restaurant.
Table space was proportionate to the size of their plates and we felt comfortable shifting the main dishes around, even with drinks. Not squeezed.
Chairs were comfortable.
Warm and cold water dispenser was available, probably for during peak hours.
Paynow, paywave available.

title: Jacob's Cafe

text: Since the introduction of their new menu as well as new management, the standard has dropped in terms of food and service staff's ability to take simple instructions.

text:
First time dinning at Jacobcafe. It was no wait. Gotten table immediately.
Environment is also easy for conversation with some light background song.
Staff very diligent and very attentive. He will help to fill up water very frequently without needed to call for refill.
Fish & Chip is nice, batter not too thick
Australian Lamb Chop takes a while to prepare due to the nature of the dish. Has it medium rare, it came out delicious, don't have the strong smell..we like it. Chicken curry with choice or white rice or bread is also taste fresh, not spicy, easy to eat. To add on the chicken in the curry is boneless. Recommend

I wanted to leave a tip for the young man who was attentive all night , so I left five dollars on the table . I told him it was for him . His boss aggressively took the money from him and put it in his pocket. I was going to recommend the place to friends and family , but now I won‚Äôt be .

title: HAEDEUM CHARCOAL BBQ
name: Mia
text:
Masshiseoyo!! A reliable kbbq place I always go to! Their bbq meat is something I always think about. Their 2-3 person set is usually enough to feed 4 moderate eaters after adding sides. Banchan is provided as well!

I ordered their chicken and pork set which was just *chefs kiss*. The pork was succulent and not too gamey! The chicken was tender and chewy. Not sure what magic they do to their meat texture here but sooo good! The variety of marinated meats also meant that it didn‚Äôt get jelat fast.

The owner was kind enough to help / teach us how to grill and have the meat correctly. Service staff was also very attentive and changed our charred grill almost after every one meat. They are all super friendly :)

This time, I ordered the samgyetang but it did not quite meet my expectations. There wasn‚Äôt enough herbal? flavour in the soup. The soup pretty much tasted like plain soup to me.

However, the kimchi pancake was pretty good! Crispy on the outside and there wasn‚Äôt excessive batter.

Do order their fried chicken!!! Sooo good! I didn‚Äôt order this time bc the portion was too much! Huuuuge! The chicken is super juicy and its juices literally will splash out as u bite into it. Comparable to pizzamaru (if uk how good theirs is)

Overall, do visit! Ps they are named don dae Bak bbq place irl~

title: S Aesthetics Clinic
name: Bear Pang (Beary)
text:
I recently visited this clinic for a facial treatment, paying $416 for what I expected to be a premium experience. Unfortunately, it turned out to be the worst facial I‚Äôve ever had.

To begin with, the service fell far below the standards I anticipated for the price. I wasn‚Äôt asked to change out of my clothes, which was surprising and uncomfortable. Additionally, the facial bed had visible hair on it, raising concerns about hygiene and attention to detail.

During the treatment, the manual extraction process was extremely painful, and the therapist repeatedly complained about the condition of my skin. While I was aware my skin wasn‚Äôt in perfect shape, that‚Äôs precisely why I sought professional care. To address the issue, I even opted for an additional treatment at an extra cost of $188, hoping for better results.

However, not only did the facial fail to improve my skin, but it also left my face damaged, with small bumps that persist even after the treatment. Overall, the experience was deeply disappointing, especially given the high cost and the lack of professionalism. I would not recommend this place to anyone seeking quality skincare services. See attached for my a photo of my skin 10 hours post-treatment.

Reservations are exclusively via WhatsApp ‚Äî which is a genius idea if you want to practice patience, meditation, and acceptance of silence. No replies? Perfect! Phone calls? Oh, that‚Äôs just for decoration. Apologies for replying late? Why ruin the suspense? Truly a masterclass in how to keep customers guessing. Can‚Äôt wait to‚Ä¶ never try again.

text: Been a member since their opening and never looked back! I‚Äôve been friends with Ryan and Colan since day one‚Äîthey‚Äôre not just friendly, they truly make you feel at home. The community spirit here is incredibly high, and the vibes are something I‚Äôve never experienced in any other gym before. The equipment is always well-maintained, the place is spotless, and the atmosphere makes you actually look forward to working out. Everyone here, from the staff to the members, is welcoming and supportive. Easily the best gym experience I‚Äôve ever had!

title: Anytime Fitness D'Arena Jurong
name: Wayne Liao
text:
I‚Äôve been training at this branch for a while now and it‚Äôs easily one of the best gyms in the area. The environment is clean, well-maintained, and spacious ‚Äî even during peak hours, it never feels overcrowded.

The equipment is modern and comprehensive, catering to all types of workouts ‚Äî from strength training to cardio and functional exercises. Machines are always in good working condition, and any maintenance is attended to quickly.

What really sets this gym apart is the team. The staff are friendly, professional, and always ready to help. Whether it‚Äôs assisting with equipment, answering questions, or just offering a warm greeting, their positive energy makes a big difference.

It‚Äôs also a huge plus that the gym is open 24/7 ‚Äî super convenient for those with busy or irregular schedules.

If you‚Äôre looking for a supportive and clean environment to work out in Jurong, I highly recommend giving this place a try!

text: Very spacious gym and the community here is very welcoming as well! The staffs here are always cheerful and the members are quite friendly as well! I also love that they have a variety of classes! Will definitely recommend my friends to sign up here when I can!

name: l l.
text:
My first AF gym, and still the best AF gym I've been to. It may not be the biggest but it makes up for it with a wide variety of equipment that ensures you'll have a well rounded workout. The space is clean, and the huge amount of natural lighting makes this a very bright and comfortable space to work out in.

The provision of free towels is something that's spoilt me ‚Äî now I'm always looking for towels in other gyms. üëÄ

And of course, big shout out to the team here at d'Arena. I've yet to go to an outlet with staff that is this friendly and welcoming. They serve with a smile and really makes you feel like they are happy to help, and that you're not a bother. P.s. Colan: long time no see, but miss talking to you. Always makes me feel like I'm catching up with family when you come by to talk to me ü•∞

It takes me an hour to get to this gym from home, and I still make time to go down when I can even though there's a few different AF gyms that are closer to me. Hope that tells you what you need to know about this gym üí™

Oh also, the music here is awesome. üòâü§≠

name: caleb C
text:
I've been going to this gym for a few months now, and it's easily one of the best fitness centers I've ever been a part of. The equipment is top-notch and always clean and well-maintained, and there's plenty of variety whether you're into weightlifting, cardio, or functional training.

The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to help without being pushy. The personal trainers are fantastic and really take the time to understand your goals. I also really appreciate the class options.

There's a real sense of community here, and it‚Äôs just a great environment to stay motivated. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a seasoned gym goer, this place has something for everyone. Definitely worth checking out!

title: Anytime Fitness D'Arena Jurong
name: Muhammad Zulfadly Bin Abdul Manap
text: Good outlet. Quite empty on a weekday afternoon. Plenty of squat racks and a platform for powerlifting. The variety machine is also great. The functional training area is big with good equipment such as sleds and ski-ergs. For those who love group exercises, they also have classes in the evenings. Staffs are quite friendly. They also provide small towels for your workout. Such a shame I don't stay anywhere near this outlet, else I would frequent here.

title: Anytime Fitness D'Arena Jurong
name: Val Ng (SeiHao)
text:
I‚Äôve been using this gym for almost two years, and it has been a fantastic experience. The gym is well-maintained, spacious, and equipped with high-quality machines and free weights, making it a great place for both beginners and experienced lifters.

Colon and Ryan are incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and approachable. The gym has an energizing atmosphere, with great music and a supportive community that fosters a positive vibe.

The class offerings are impressive as well, with a variety of options ranging from strength training to yoga, zumba and many more. Personal training services are also available for those looking for extra guidance.

Overall, I‚Äôd say d‚ÄôArena AF is a top-notch fitness center that offers everything needed for a great workout experience. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a gym that is well-equipped, clean, and welcoming. üëçüèªüëçüèª

text: Very good and responsive staffs, always prompting gym goers to go for vis body and they are very concern about our progress and well being - Colan and Ryan Thumbs Up üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº

title: Anytime Fitness D'Arena Jurong
name: Jameson Tan
text:
The gym offers a welcoming atmosphere, with friendly and approachable staff who make every visit enjoyable. They go the extra mile by offering a free body scan every three months, helping members track their progress and stay motivated. Occasionally, they even give out complimentary parking coupons, adding a nice touch of convenience for their members. For added comfort, they provide free towels for members to use during their workouts. The equipment is always well-maintained, ensuring a safe and effective workout environment. The community is equally supportive, with members being friendly and always willing to share tips and advice, making it a great place to grow and achieve your fitness goals.

Highly recommended!

text: Staff is friendly and engaging. Gym is equipped with versatile facilities and facilities are new and clean. Recommended!

text: Very happy to discover this AF branch! The staffs here are very friendly especially Ryan! This gym has good equipments and a terrific atmosphere to workout. Highly recommended!

title: Anytime Fitness D'Arena Jurong
name: Su Hui
text:
My initial experience was great. I‚Äôve heard horror stories of members who had issues cancelling their membership with other AF branches and was assured it wouldn‚Äôt happen here. I signed up for 18 months and was relatively happy throughout, the people are nice. However, when it came time to cancel my membership, they kept delaying their response and didn‚Äôt want to furnish me with the form to confirm the cancellation. I was constantly asked to go down to their gym and asked why I wanted to cancel (when I had already given my reasoning a few times both on text and in person). After much chasing I finally got the cancellation form and was assured that January will be my final billing month.

Today (1st February) my credit card was charged and I am appalled at the service of this gym. I‚Äôve reached out to their team and hope their service recovery will redeem them.

Just to be clear, AF is great if you have no intentions to leave. It‚Äôs only problematic when you try to cancel your membership. I have been highly dissatisfied with the cancellation process and communication hence the low rating.

title: Anytime Fitness D'Arena Jurong
name: pony
text:
AF D‚ÄôArena truly stands out as the best. The facility is massive, spacious, and meticulously clean with a variety of equipment to meet every need. The huge functional area is a game-changer, providing ample space for workouts.

The washrooms are spotless, and the amenities offered, such as towels and chargers, really enhance the overall workout experience. What truly sets this gym apart, though, is the staff. They are extremely kind, always friendly, and genuinely care about the members. Shoutout to Colan, Ryan, and Hazwan!

Recently, the gym organized a trip to Batam, which was packed with fun activities for everyone. It was such a thoughtful gesture, and shows how much they value their community. The members here are like a family, making the gym experience wholesome and enjoyable.

Overall, this is hands down the best gym ever, with absolutely no complaints or bad remarks from me. Highly recommend!

You won't be disappointed. We also tried their Americano coffee. It is very nice and flavourful. Overall the food is great and highly recommendes.

Will definitely be back to try the other items

text: Food came fast. Fried chicken was nicely deep fried with crispy skin. They are generous with their fries. Shoestring fries fried till golden brown and well seasoned. Crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Super addictive. Softshell crab burger was also very good. The rich, silky and sweet cameralised onions add a magical touch to the burger. However, the Softshell crab Pasta was not as good. The batter was thick and doughy, (refer to photo) which made it surfeiting. Lychee Earl Grey was refreshing though I would prefer it less sweet.

name: Min Alisha
text:
Interesting cafe to go. Went on a weekday so there were less people. Very nice ambiance and love the fact they use cute glasses to serve their drinks and free drinking water provided as well.
Coffee was good for an independent cafe. The waffle we ordered was scrumptious and good to feed 2 person a portion. It will be great if the vibe is more welcoming from the staffs, that‚Äôll fluff the store higher üòä

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Tracy Tracy
text: Dessert with coffee is the best combination!!! Love the service, love the atmosphere of cos the cake and hazelnut coffee üòçüòç

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Jo Lee
text: I've been here for dinner on one of the weekends. Overall, the food was up to the standard of a typical cafe. We ordered two main courses, which were serving along with the complimentary mushroom soup. My kid enjoyed the waffles topped with the ice cream.

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Thomas Lim
text: Unsure about what‚Äôs with all the 4-5 star reviews. Food is definitely very mediocre. Just look at the menu nothing stands out. Price is so high which can‚Äôt justify the food standards.

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: may soe
text: Good food & service and have a nice place.

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Doreen Luah
text:
A cozy find at Punggol Coast Mall!

White Cloud Cafe offers a simple and easy-to-understand menu, with prices comparable to most cafes in Singapore. One great perk for dine-in guests is their 20% discount on mains during weekdays from 10am to 5pm, which makes it even more worthwhile. They also have a student meal set at $13.50, which includes a main and a drink.

My daughter ordered the Cajun Pork Chop, which came with a generous portion of salad and mashed potatoes, and a complimentary iced Coke as part of the student meal. I went for the Baked Haddock Fish Fillet served with saut√©ed mushrooms in garlic and mashed potatoes.

Their mashed potatoes truly stole the show ‚Äî ultra smooth, creamy, and buttery. I rarely finish mashed potatoes, but I cleaned the plate this time. A close second would be the saut√©ed mushrooms, which were packed with flavour and nicely done with minced garlic.

A pleasant spot with decent food and thoughtful weekday deals ‚Äî definitely worth a try if you‚Äôre around the area!

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Min Min Latt
text: Premium Class. My favourite is fried chicken wings and Mushroom soup.

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: flaire hui sin
text: The cafe is comforting and food are greatly cooked

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: ana gamboa
text: Good food & service and have a nice ambience.

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Kelly Poon
text: The food was totally worth it and drink were very nice and refreshing

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Low Wee Pin
text:
When I stepped into the cafe, the first thing that caught my eye was the uniquely designed ceiling - it adds a lot of character to the whole space. The atmosphere is warm and cozy, perfect for relaxing alone or catching up with friends.
The food was delicious, fried chicken and truffle fries were crispy, the chicken chop was beautifully presented, and the polite and attentive staff made the dining experience even more pleasant.
I tried the lemon meringue and it was absolutely amazing - the balance of sweet and sour was just right. Paired with a cup of fragrant Earl Grey tea, it was simply amazing!

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Sunbreeze Cazi
text:
Tried the recommended fish, not as nice as I thought.

Din try the pork chop which the auntie emphasized got 2 pieces to our and another table. Maybe that was the nicer option.

The fries and nugget are standards u can get when u do it yr own with frozen ones at home. Carbonara was pretty standard too. Nothing to rave about.

Service was prompt and good though. $80 there about for 3 adults, one child and a toddler. Din felt like it was worth that price. Maybe because we din order the chicken chop. :(

title: White Cloud Cafe
name: Blue Moon
text: Go there only if u don't use toilets or don't mind smelly toilets sprayed with overpowering artificial fragrance. Water level at the tap is so slow flowing it makes me wonder if the mall mgt does not pay their water bill.

May 2025

text:
Walked in with freshly washed hair, came out with oily smelly hair as if i went to a bbq place.

Smoked salmon toast - The best thing on the plate was the salad. Salmon was super fishy, quite nauseating. The sourdough bread was soggy and not toasted at all.

Mushroom soup - clearly microwaved (the bowl was hot to the touch) Tasted like corn soup instead, truly the worst mushroom soup i‚Äôve ever had.

Matcha latte - literally tasted like matcha powder + water.

Only pros about this place are the ambience and acceptance of cdc voucher.

title: Into The Woods Cafe

text:
service was great and staff, spencer, was very attentive and friendly! and food was fantastic too!

i had the beef lasagna and my partner had the creamy salmon mushroom pasta. very flavourful and yummyyy.

had the iced french chocolate drink and root beer float, which we think is nice also. the vanilla gelato on top of the root beer was really good gelatoüòÇ

overall was very good, portion sizes are just nice and it's pretty worth it for the price.

will come back again ü§©

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Adeline Teh
text: It's a nice cafe. Ordered a beef burger with cheese expecting a cheese burger but... The "burger" came w bulgogi beef(?) instead. No patty. It's essentially a bulgogi beef sandwich w a burger bun. But, it tasted good! Surprised but no complains. It came with REALLY good fries. Hojicha latte needs more sugar. Good quiet spot for remote work too. A tad pricey tho.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: xeb
text:
The food was great and the portion was decent for the pricing. The cafe also gave off a very relaxing vibe so I‚Äôd recommend coming here if you‚Äôre not in a rush and you‚Äôd like to chill. The staff were also very nice and ensured that we had a pleasant experience while dining in.
Overall, good recommend for people who live around the area and even if you don‚Äôt, you won‚Äôt regret stopping by for a meal!
Also, I personally really enjoyed the choice of music in the cafe! Really nice to hear songs from the 80s :)

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: pigeons to go
text:
Came back again with my bf. Had their pizza and mushroom soup and my bf had their tomato soup. Simply love it !
This time we came back for their pasta. Fantastic ! Both of us love it.
After reading some reviews and the last negative review of their waffle , we decided to give it a try as my bf is a waffle lover and he knows what makes a good waffle. His feedback is very good. I saw majority of feedback here is good and we find it legit. Quite surprise on some negative feedback. Guess some people have very high expectation. We will always support honest local business.

Will definitely be back again with friends.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: darius murali
text:
Visited this caf√© for dinner and unfortunately, the entire experience was underwhelming and far from what I expected for the price point.

The Teriyaki Chicken Pizza served was clearly a frozen base with some meat simply added on top.
Something I could have made at home with minimal effort.

For the Chicken and Waffle, the waffle tasted like it came straight from the freezer, the chicken had that dry, air-fried texture and the egg was completely bland with no seasoning at all.

The Mushroom Soup was by far the most disappointing dish. It somehow tasted worse than canned soup, with an odd bitter aftertaste that made it hard to finish. The garlic bread was just a hard piece of bread with some garlic bits sprinkled on top. No flavour, no creaminess. Nothing redeeming.

To make matters worse, the prices were on the higher end. For the quality we received, it simply felt like we were being overcharged. I honestly left feeling like I wasted my money and I believe a refund would be fair considering the poor quality of the meal.

Not a place I‚Äôll be returning to or recommending.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Jolyn Lee
text:
First time came here to try. Ambience very nice. Service crew very attentive. Love their Teriyaki pizza.
One of the best coffee i had so far.
Will definitely come back again.

title: Into The Woods Cafe

text: Nice ambience with a large cafe that is very welcoming. However the croissant was soggy (expected since it‚Äôs egg mayo) which resulted in being very hard to cut. Price is reasonable

text: We had drinks and waffle today, and I paid the bill of $29.48 with CDC vouchers of $30.00. I never got the change 50cts (52cts) back as the 'cashier' gave me the receipt and quickly walked away. I was rather taken by that. Is this the norm or I missed something here?

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Avril Atkeg
text:
Fits its name, suggesting a place away from the hustle and bustle of urban life.  Parking is along the service road, so lots are limited. Avoid peak hours.

Breakfasts are the best food options. Avocado toast had generous toppings with flavourful sauce. Egg croissant was somewhat dry and too buttery. Aglio olio is flavourful and rich with olive oil. Enjoyed the chai latte for its fragrance and cinnamon stick stirrer.

Service is excellent and friendly, though somewhat understaffed. Would definitely be back to try the other mains.

text: Went there on a Sunday afternoon. Food & service was good. Only thing is the ventilation was no good. The whole place very strong oil cooking smell. Was full of perfume smell before went in, came out  whole body including my handbag very smelly. Please look into the exhaust.

Looking forward to be back again !

The strawberry ice-cream taste so so artificial and fake.. very disappointed with the quality I get with the price I have paid. By the way, it was at kampung admiralty.

title: SOD Cafe
name: ET
text:
It was our first visit to SOD at Ci Yuan CC, and also our first time trying this caf√© when we were craving a hearty guacamole soft bread breakfast. The portion was generous, the taste delightful, and the price reasonable.

The caf√© has a cosy, neighbourhood charm, not large, but comfortable enough. It opens at 11am, and within half an hour, the crowd starts to fill the place. The ventilation is excellent with no lingering cooking smell, and the aircon is perfectly cool for a relaxed breakfast.

Highly recommended if you are looking for a comfortable spot to enjoy a hearty, satisfying start to your day.

Plates and utensils were not clean - a lot of marks on them. They can be wiped off but definitely not a presentable manner to serve to a customer in an fnb restaurant.

SOD cafe is a neighbourhood gem!

We have been patronising this cafe for a few years now. Service is excellent - staff are always polite, patient and friendly.

We love the food! Prices are reasonable and the food always tastes amazing. Fish is fresh, chicken is always well-cooked and tender. The pulled pork is well flavoured and tender too.

I would absolutely recommend coming her for a meal. My family and I will continue to be regular patrons because we enjoy the food so much :)

title: SOD Cafe

title: SOD Cafe
name: tam tam
text: I already sat down at a 4 seater table with my friend and waiting for my order and this male staff just came and tell us to shift to another seat. I clearly said no and he stared at me as if he is unhappy or surprised a customer said no to him. I had to suggest an alternative way to split the 4 seater into two tables without the need to shift again. He was not quick thinking at all and never had any plan b in mind if a customer does reject his suggestions. Please improve the way you let people seat when they come in. I asked the cashier if i can seat at the 4 seater, she said ok. This male staff suddenly pops up and tells us otherwise. Don't let customers come in and happily sitting down then come tell them to shift around. Would have given  1 star if not for the nice ladies with good service.

title: SOD Cafe
name: Daniel Koh
text:
[SOD Cafe]
üåü 9/10
üìç Ci Yuan CC
üí∞ Expected damage $15-$25

Value for money and no service charge. This place has been around for a long time and their serving is huge for their prices. My personal recommendation is their mentaiko pasta with the fried chicken. The sauce makes the pasta very savoury which goes well with the crispy chicken. Wanted to try their soft shell crab mentaiko pasta but they only serve it at the upper thompson branch.

The mentaiko Mac N' Cheese is very decadent due to the heaping amount of cheese which caters to many young cheese lovers. Fried chicken and waffle was good and a go-to for those craving a sweet and savoury meal once in a while.

The dessert - devils chocolate cake, is the icing on the cake as it was so thick and sinful. When paired with the ice cream, you are guaranteed to be seeing a doctor soon which is the job of a good dessert. Definitely recommend this place üëç

title: Kebun Baru Community Club
name: Kim Kim
text:
My child went for class last Monday and was shot in the right eye at close range by one of the classmates using a solid rubber ball. She cried non stop when in the class and continued crying the whole night. She was very traumatised and fear going back to the class. We have stopped the class for her. We went to the doctor thrice in the past week.
The teacher didn‚Äôt even ask the parent of the culprit (a boy who is notorious in the class) to stay behind after class to speak to us. This is unacceptable.
We understand that this matter has been reported to KBCC but after one week- nobody has bothered to reach out to us to even follow up and see whether we need any assistance. Either they are too busy or such accidents happen so often that there‚Äôs no cause for alarm even when children‚Äôs eyes are injured while attending classes at this CC.
This is horrible- Attend classes at your own risks.

title: Woodlands Galaxy Community Club
name: Zen S
text:
Visited the badminton courts at Woodlands Galaxy Community Club on 5 April (7:30‚Äì9:30 PM) and had a terrible experience. There is a female Indian staff member (likely a cleaner or facility attendant) who was extremely rude and aggressive throughout our session.

She was yelling at everyone in a loud and hostile tone, accusing us of placing items around the court that we didn‚Äôt even touch. Her behavior was completely uncalled for and made the environment feel tense and unwelcoming. To make things worse, she shouted at us to leave two minutes before our session officially ended, just so she could close up early. We paid for the court and expected to use it peacefully till the end, not to be rushed and yelled at.

This is supposed to be a community facility for everyone ‚Äì children, the elderly, and families ‚Äì to enjoy an active lifestyle in a safe and friendly space. Instead, we were made to feel like a nuisance.

Honestly, not a conducive or welcoming place at all if this is how patrons are treated. Proper staff training is clearly lacking here. I‚Äôll also be raising this to relevant channels because our community deserves better ‚Äì at the very least, some basic respect and professionalism from staff.

title: Woodlands Galaxy Community Club
name: Faye
text:
Had an absolutely awful experience at the community center today (March 1, 2025, around 10:30 AM). I had the misfortune of interacting with an extremely rude and unhelpful staff member ‚Äì an Indian lady who was not only unprofessional but also downright dismissive.

We approached her politely to ask for information about an upcoming award ceremony. Instead of offering any assistance, she grumpily told us she didn‚Äôt know, her manager wasn‚Äôt around, and she couldn't check anything for us. When we asked about the location, her response was simply ‚Äúdon‚Äôt know,‚Äù with no effort to help us further.

It's shocking that a community center, which is meant to help residents, has staff members like this who seem to have no interest in doing their job properly. Even the Minister would never treat residents with such disrespect. I truly hope the center takes action to investigate and ensure this staff member doesn‚Äôt continue to spoil its reputation. Not the level of service I expected at all.

text: Probably the best duck rice and noodles in western part of Singapore. Definitely top 3 stall in Tuas. Duck is tender, the sauce is thick and flavourful. Uncle is also very friendly, will ask for feedback and willing to share tips on how to make a solid bowl of soup. Price wise also very friendly, and serving is rather generous as well.

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: samy suriya
text: üëå

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: MNG
text:
Its rice is cooked perfectly with every grain being evident, instead of being mushy. It also cooked with shredded cabbage, lending it a nice aroma.

Braised peanut, Tofu and hard boiled egg which were good but not outstanding.

Duck was outstanding. It had a bite and great flavors.

Soup had a medicinal flavor and was robust tasting.

A surprising find in an obscured area of this tiny island.

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Garry Go
text: Duck was tender and flavourful with a mild herbal taste. Kuey was cooked well too.

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Clark Tan
text: Journey to Far West for this GEM (Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice). Duck meat was tender and well braised, a mild herbal taste drenched with thick braised savoury herbal savoury sweet sauce. Yam rice was a bit dry, but goes went with the braised sauce. Their kuay chap was a HIT for me. Kuay was soft, and soup was flavourful and had a delightful herbal taste. Their pork skin was tender, and intestines were clean with mild porky taste. They served 2 types of chillies, garlicky that goes well with kuay chap and the savoury sambal with a kick that match make with duck rice. A Good Jiaküëçüèªü§§üëçüèª

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Xin Yi Lim
text: Didn‚Äôt expect myself to commit to F45 after ending my 2 weeks trial. For someone who don‚Äôt exercise at all, I was really nervous especially during the first lesson but Coach Dhyaanesh and his team gave me a warm welcome with demonstrations for every lesson. They are very professional and will keep a look out on you to ensure that you are able to keep it up. If you are looking for somewhere to try out F45, please visit F45 Jurong West! Their 2 weeks trial is really affordable and worth your time and money!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: S
text:
If you're looking for a motivating environment to push your limits, F45 is the place to be! From the moment I walked through the door, I felt welcomed and supported by the coaches. The workouts are energizing and varied, keeping things fresh and challenging every session.
The coaches are exceptionally knowledgeable and patient too. Coach Dhyaanesh took note of my injury before the session began and modified workouts to make sure I don't further injure myself. I've experienced fantastic improvements in my strength and endurance and I always look forward to my workouts. Thank you, F45 for making fitness fun!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: syahidah abidin
text:
I‚Äôve been a member of F45 Jurong West for almost a year. This is my 4th F45 and my favourite F45 club. The owner and trainer Dhyaanesh is very kind and a great trainer. Shami the other owner and in charge of admin is very responsive. They have other amazing trainers like Jay and Aiz who always fast to assist and give positive feedback and push you during your session as well.
F45 JW also organise gatherings as well for time to time to interact with other members as well.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: P-R P
text: It's been a real pleasure working out at F45 Jurong West Dhyaanesh and his team are always the best in supporting ensuring you're training safely and also making sure you're challenged during your workout! Looking forward for more session!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Saravanan A.
text:
Tried going for the F45 challenge(45days). Trainers in this outlet is good, classes were effective.

Strongly recommend if you would like to get to a healthy lifestyle. The key is to turn up for classes everyday and leave it for the program to shape you.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Jessie Lee
text:
Thankful for the season at F45 Jurong West. My spouse and I are very grateful for the patience coaching by Founder/Coach Dhyaanesh, Coach Aziz, Coach Jay etc during our time there. Both of us didn‚Äôt have fitness background and starting the fitness journey were intimidating for us but the team of dedicated and experienced Coaches and F45‚Äôs thoughtful workout design for strength and cardio made it easy for us to follow through. It‚Äôs really fun and motivating that the classes change every 4 weeks. You never have to worry of getting bored. We were usually at the morning 7.15am and the evening 7.15pm or 8.15pm classes. We enjoyed the quietness of morning and the busyness of evening classes. The clean shower room was important for me when I attended the morning classes before work and the best part is it‚Äôs usually unoccupied.

While we decided to pause our fitness journey with F45 fitness this season due to my spouse‚Äôs work schedule, we would love to be back in near future.

Highly recommended for you if you‚Äôre on the verge of making a decision. You can try them for 2 weeks trial first.

Pro-tips :
1) Don‚Äôt stop after 1 session, push through the sessions and your aches and sores would feel less intensive. For us, we kind of recovered after 3 consecutive days of classes when our muscles adapted.

2) Do what your Coaches told you. We were often in Coach Dhyaanesh and Coach Jay‚Äôs classes, they were really helpful to correct us or show us modified workout when they saw us struggling.

3) Ask the Coaches if you‚Äôre sure. During one of the busy classes, I remember feeling unsure how I should hold the weight and I was glad I asked Coach Aziz. It was important for me I picked up the right habits.

4) Go slow and focus on form when you‚Äôre new. We are glad we learnt our foundation from them.

Thank you, Coach Dhyaanesh and F45 Jurong West!

Oh yah, there‚Äôs a Sheng Siong supermarket and a coffeeshop nearby. Very convenient!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Celine Hueysan
text: The best gym I have ever been to. Awesome gym buddies and coaches. It is not those standard gym but a community where everyone get together to have fun and train to keep fit.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Vanessa Low
text: I have been going to F45 Jurong West for more than half a year and I love the classes, the coaches and the community. The classes have really helped with my weight loss journey and I love that every class is always different!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Jocelyn Lew
text: My time at F45 Studio has been exceptional. The studio's ambiance is welcoming, the coaches are professional and friendly, and the pricing is reasonable. It's a top choice for anyone seeking effective workouts and a supportive environment. Highly recommended!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Sheryl Soh
text:
Joined the studio in Sept 2023 and have been loving it so far. The workouts are fun and if you stay to your goals, you will be able to lose some weight and gain muscles like I do.

The coaches are very friendly and they are always around to push/motivate you when you need it. There are many different classes timings that will definitely catered to your needs too. I have personally attended morning, afternoon and the night classes.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: amy chan
text: F45 Jurong West has a very inclusive environment. I brought my elderly parents to work out with me and despite them not being able to fit in, the team was so patient and ever-ready to make my parents' fitness experience a safe, effective, pleasant and memorable one. Thank you to each and every one of the coaches! We hope to be back soon.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Matthew Chua
text:
Joined last Aug, never look back since.
Coach: Dhyaanesh led a team of wonderful coaches.
Difficulty: The work out can be modified for anyone.
Location: Near coffeeshop and Shengsiong, but I suggest you stay away
Price: It depends how often you go  Maximize it by attending everyday
Overall: I improved my BMI, fitness level and overall wellness after joining.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Genevieve Teo
text:
Super glad I embarked my fitness journey with F45 JW. There‚Äôs a place for everyone here - regardless of your fitness level! Trainers are extremely encouraging and patient + studio size is very decent.

Great location for westies since you can get your grocery fix right after the session! üòâ

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Joelle Teo
text: Very helpful coaches who guide and encourage us according to our individual abilities. No stress workouts! Best for beginners like me, rusty from years of inactivity, and afraid to enter a gym!  F45 Jurong West has the friendliest coaches and workout buddies!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Joel Kwa
text:
I been to ~10 fitness centers since last year and was trying to find a good place to commit long term. It is this place man. Super worth it in terms of price.

The coaches here are 10/10. They are all supportive, instructive and encouraging.

The equipments are we kept and facilities clean. Air conditioned.

Oh it's also above the Sheng Shiong supermarket and beside a food court. So I usually time my groceries shopping when I go for a session.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Zaafarani Choma'at
text: Really friendly and knowledgeable trainers and owner/trainer. Loved my experience there!

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Y C
text: I work around Tuas. Broth is slightly too sweet for me, and duck slightly tough. It is a normal bowl of kwap zap. Will not make a special trip for it next time but definitely a hearty bowl for those who works nearby!

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Alex Teo
text: Very nice. Must try!

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Ooi Yeong Lih
text: Must eat !!!

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Waye Seah
text: Not easy to get good food in Tuas South!! This is a good reason to come to Tuas.

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Ivan Soh
text: Duck rice and chilli is nice. Worth to come here to eat

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Pam n' Rach
text: Both uncle and aunty was all smiles and very polite. We love how thinly sliced the duck was and the broth was light, herbalicious, clear and delicious. We enjoyed every bit of it. Thank you for the sumptuous breakfast!

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: Lincoln Lee
text: Authentic old school braise duck flavours, they use yam to cook their braise duck rice which is rare nowadays. I've tried the braised duck rice, noodles and kway chup. The surprising take away is they have very good soup, it's super tasty, I asked for refills and owners were more than happy to give you more refills. Very good service and owners also asked for feedbacks for further improvement from customers. Will recommend anyone to go give it a try.

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: ËÇ•Â§ßÁãº
text: Very delicious duck rice, the braised meat is very flavourful .  Store owners very friendly and polite . Would definitely come back again üòâ

title: Heng Heng Boneless Duck Rice
name: jim brusin
text: Surprised to have good duck rice in this food court in Tuas. I added large intestines and paid 7.50 and it‚Äôs worth the price.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: siti nur nazihah
text: The trainers were extremely patient and helpful. I had my reservations to join F45 as I was concerned that the workouts would be too fast paced. However, the trainers ensured that I paced myself and started slow to get my body accustomed to the trainings. The trainers were also very knowledgeable and were always on the lookout to ensure that your form is proper. Gotta say, i've no regrets signing up!

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Damian Ng
text:
Pricing was definitely a big consideration factor at first but after going to the classes for a month, the value definitely comes from having a room full of equipment set up according to the day's planned workout. So all we gotta do is to make sure we turn up, get a good sweat and get out of there. And the exercises are different every day, so there is a good mix up to keep us guessing and scare before our next session. üòÖ

Can we do HIIT ourselves? We could but it is more fun with more variations that include kettlebells, bar bells, rowing machines and exercise balls. üòâ

4 weeks into our F45 Challenge and I am glad to have started this journey with my buddy.

He is strong and consistent. Always pushing me hard and encouraging me in our sessions. The coaches as well. While they are not those hellish trainers from BMT, they do challenge you and the onus is on us to take their souls David Goggins' style and push through.

It is good that @f45_training_jurongwest is near to both of our homes, so it was convenient to check in, get the work done and get back to both of our families and lives.

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Yuenting Soon
text: So glad a studio opened up in the area so there is no excuse to get myself moving!! The owners & trainers are really friendly and eager to help, i have definitely gotten stronger throughout my time training here. Also made some great friends too, truly a great community to be around! üòä

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Wong Min
text: Great, friendly coaches! Really happy that I have found something fun and works with my timing to help me with my fitness journey üëç

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Izaan Tari
text: This place got me hooked to a workout routine.. great atmosphere.. amazing people.. and excellent coaches... Continue the good work Dhyaneesh and team !

title: F45 Jurong West
name: Sandy Lu
text: Instructors at F45 Training Jurong West will propose exercises to cater to your fitness level. If you are fit, they will push and motivate you to complete exercises with heavier weights, to achieve better results. If you're struggling, they will come to you and propose alternative workout options that are less strenuous. Very encouraging and nice instructors there. Special mention to Coach Dhyaanesh and Josiah

title: F45 Jurong West
name: hh goh
text: The instructor are friendly and very helpful

He was patient in understanding what kind of pants I was looking for and explained the different cuts and fits in detail. With his guidance, I managed to find the pair that suited me best. both comfortable and stylish for workwear !! üòÜ Really appreciate his professionalism and friendly service. Thank you, Azril!

text: I ordered the Pork Katsu Curry Rice with an add-on of miso soup and cabbage. The pork katsu was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, prepared well without any greasy aftertaste. The curry was slightly on the bland side, but it still complemented the rice nicely. Overall, it was a well-balanced meal. I will definitely return for more.

text:
I am surprised I get to eat excellent Tonkatsu open in the coffee shop.

Whatever they served is absolutely restaurant standard, from the Crockery to the food quality and the arrangement. I am sure from the first close look at the food, many will believe that it must be a restaurant.

Taste wise, absolutely hit the mark - Restaurant standard. The portion is also very generous and it is rather affordable too.

Ex-restaurant chef is no joke and it is worthy of its reputation

title: Maruhachi - Donburi & Curry
name: David Wong
text:
Was late and worried this stall is closed.  Had gone there at 815pm n was told last order was slightly before 9pm.

Had ordered pork n chicken katsu set that came salad n soup.  Added one side dish of 2 pieces of fried ebi.  Cost almost $33.

Rather pricy for a coffee shop set up but food is of reasonable quality.  Someone reviewed as same as Ma Maison (MM).  Really?

I tapau tonkatsu from MM in JB.  The food is still excellent after 1.5 hours of commuting back to Singapore.  Food stand for that long n still taste good.  That's quality of the food at MM southkey mid valley JB.

Only a short wait at this stall and collected my order in less than 15 mins.  Rather efficient.

Stingy in giving the brown sauce!  I was only given 2 small sauce cups!!  But paid almost $32.  Rather loop sided deal!

May return if I crave for tonkatsu n around this area or don't know what to eat.  Will not be my natural choice to go to this place as the carpark exit did not allow good visibility of cars when trying to filter to the main street.

The entire team was attentive, making us feel very welcome. The ambiance was just right for a relaxed evening out. Highly recommended for anyone looking for exceptional food and top-notch service!"

text: I've been looking forward to trying Oxtail in restaurants and found Jacob‚Äôs cafe have it in menu! The taste was fantastic and yummy especially the softness of the meat. Lotsa of gravy and recommended to eat with baguette. The rest of the food was good!!!

text:
Had lunch on 22nd Nov and was reccomended the pork ribs. The outer layer was hard and slightly burnt, the mash potatoes were tasteless and the sauce didn't go well with the ribs. When I informed the waiter about it, he got the cook out to my table and told him 'customer complained about the food' ..
Left disappointed and wondered how the quality of food has deteriorated over the months.

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: Noclaf
text:
Food is delicious, portions are generous and price is reasonable. Service is also pretty good.
And even though they don't have a kids menu, they are flexible enough to reduce the portion on the normal menu item and just charge half price.

title: Jacob's Cafe

text: Nice quiet place for lunch with the kids‚Ä¶

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: Yew Meng Chong
text: Highly Recommended. Delicious Melt-in-your-mouth barbecue pork ribs were the ace special of the day. on the regular menu, the mutton soup is accompanied with this excellent fresh chili sauce and your choice of rice or baguette. Edamame portions are generous. The coconut shakes are fun too. Chill ambience.

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: Serene Tan
text: Hundred % attentive staff, really good food and enjoyed the vibe here. Recommended to eat Hainanese braised pork trotters and German pork knuckle as well as the BBQ pork ribs. Glad my family enjoyed the food here. Highly recommended to come here

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: S Foo
text:
The eatery has both indoor and outdoor seatings. No charge for water. There is a service tax and no GST. Polite Myanmarese wait staff.

For $29.90 you get quite a big serving of Oxtail Stew. You can either choose to have it served with rice or baguette. There were 3 pieces of fairly large ox tail, big potato chunks, carrots and whole onion. The ox tail meat was soft and came off the bone easily.

The chicken curry ($15.90) was surprisingly not oily unlike the ones you normally get served with a layer of oil floating on the surface. It did not have the cloying sweetness of a lemak curry. Strong smell of spices reminiscent of Indian curry. Decent pieces of chicken however disappointed that there was only 1 piece of potato the size of a 50 cents coin.

title: Jacob's Cafe
name: Hui Leng Khoo
text: We ordered hainanese lamb shank, fish and chips and Dory aglio olio for lunch on national day and they were all delicious. Service was great too and they would top up our drinking water glasses regularly (much appreciated). Will definitely return again to try more dishes!

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Richard Tock
text: The Cafe is very spacious, looks pretty cozy, but the service was horrible.  The server will never make eye contact with dinners and oblivious to their needs, impossible to get her attention until i have to raise my voice and walk up to her this evening on Vesak Day.  Totally regret ordering the Pizza too told the waitress - I will never order this frozen pizza-  and she simply laugh it off/walk away with no apologies.  I Told her that to serve my Flat White after my meal,  but she didn't pay match attention to this small detail either  tried getting her attention to no avail.  After more than 15 mins,  I have to walk up to the counter to get her attention.  Never coming back forever.  such an unfriendly service right from the start- No one will ever greet the dinners when they walk in & No one will thank the dinners when they leave. (bunch of untrained staff)

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: BabaMakan
text:
After reading the reviews decided to give it a try despite the Ventilation problem. Was disappointed that after months of feedback, it was still not resolved properly. The whole place smells oily and my clothes does smell like that after leaving the place.

Then again they are running a business and the cost to rectify this problem may be high hence the reluctance to rectify it.

To each their own, some just brush this off and are less affected by the ventilation.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Clement Cher
text:
Googled and found the following recommendation and decided to go ahead to try. Located in a quiet part of the neighbourhood, Reached there just after 2pm and there were no crowds and sitting was not a problem.  We could choose our own sitting.

Cafe was quiet and tables were either studying or having group chats. place is very instragamable. It become more crowded after 3 plus.

Minimum staff interaction which was ordering at counter and being served the food only.

Ordered honey glazed wings, Hawaiian pizza and smoked salmon waffles. Drinks called are latte and hot chocolate. Food was prepared very quickly. Food tasted great and for the portion ordered is just nice. Latte could have done with more milk in my view.

I didn't experience any bad food or service and will revisit again. A last feedback is perhaps to look to change the cushions as some are very stained. Recommended.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Yan Ching
text:
Came back.again.to this cafe on a weekday. Saw only 2 staffs working. Understand from one of the staff that they are understaff on.that day. Felt pity of them running in and out ordering.and preparing food. But the service rendered to me was still great.

Their coffee was one of the best.i had before. This will be my frequent place from now onwards.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Y C
text:
First time came to this cafe. Definitely a hidden gem. Came on a weekend and pretty crowded. Food were fantastic. Ordered almond croissant and a pizza to share with my friend. Great food ! Service was very attentive no doubt the place was crowded.
Defintely will come back again for more food and drink .

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Joel Thong
text:
Horrible place! We ordered 4 mains and a side of fries. We left most of the food untouched, and we stank of old oil leaving the restaurant.

Fries were refried. Hard and stinking of old oil.

Eggs were burnt and again stank and smelt of oil oil. Restaurant refried it but it was horrible too. Maybe a filthy pan in the mix?

Picture of the sad ham speaks for itself

Hash brown meal came quickly enough. The cheese and ham came 15mins later, the hard fries took another 20-25mins after

There‚Äôs a reason why the place was basically empty

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Kiran S
text: The food is quite good and the atmosphere is lovely. A bit on the pricey side considering the taste, but overall a nice spot for a weekend getaway.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: LYDIA Chua
text: Had the ITW Red Lake berry drink  and the red velvet cake which was nice. Came here on Good Friday night and it was quiet. Last order was 815pm n they closed at 9pm.

title: Into The Woods Cafe
name: Li Mingyue
text:
Would give more than 5 stars if we could. Had a horrible service at the nearby Italian restaurant and found this absolute gem instead. Love love loved the service and owner was so accommodating. Service was quick and amazing! My toddler spilt my hubby‚Äôs coffee accidentally and not only did the waitress and owner help us clean up immediately and check on our baby, they even made us a new cup. Really went above and beyond. We had such a great time, will definitely be back.
The crab pasta and truffle fries were super good! Baby loved them and especially loved the ice cream with the chocolate lava cake.

Many thanks to the staff and owner and see you again soon! :)
