title: Fullerton Health
name: Mei Kook
text: I visited with the intent to fill up my immunisation records for overseas exchange, and was denied at Fullerton even though NTU asked us students to go Fullerton to have it filled up. Their excuse was that we need to come before 4pm to do so, even though the clinic closes at 9pm. However, this information was nowhere stated on their website. I even called them before going down so that I could confirm but no one answered the call. Receptionist staff were very rude as well. Many of my friends also have very bad experience with Fullerton Health, including rude and incompetent staff. So NTU if you see this, please consider changing the healthcare provider if you have the slightest care for your students wellbeing.

title: Fullerton Health
name: Lily Warner
text: Bad experience twice with the doctors here. I only come here because it is the closest clinic to the school and it is hard for me to travel when I am sick. The doctors treat patients as if they are faking their illness. It is your job to give good treatment including good service to patients and you are PAID to do so even by those who are faking so what‚Äôs with the terrible attitude? If you do not like the job, stop working instead of being annoying to patients. I am already in a bad mood because I am unwell and coming here only makes it worse and the meds do not really help either. It will be great if all the doctors can be changed to better ones that have higher EQ and IQ.

title: Fullerton Health
name: JiaJuan Goh
text: As compared to NTU's other insurance providers like AIA, Fullerton's coverage really isn't good. Insurers like AIA have online platforms to facilitate claims submissions, but Fullerton makes it so inconvenient by insisting on us going to NTU clinic to get a paper form, and to submit paper receipts. Not exactly making it convenient for claims.

title: Catech Customs
name: Arjun Verma
text: Kenneth was incredibly kind and helpful throughout the entire process. I had several questions and made multiple tweaks to the configuration during our conversation, but he remained extremely patient ‚Äî even late into the night. I placed my order at 2 PM on a Sunday, and by 9 PM the same day, my dream setup was built and delivered. Kenneth ensured everything was working perfectly before handing it over, and even followed up the next day to check if the system was running smoothly or if I needed any further assistance. Their after-sales service is truly outstanding, and I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a reliable desktop setup. Truly a top-notch Carouseller.

title: Pier Medical Centre
name: Krisnan‚Äôs travel vlogs Coming soon stay tuned
text:
The staff here especially elderly ones are very rude. I came in as I booked a vaccine appointment with this clinic the elderly staff Rudely told me to do the declaration form as I presented my IC, the staff didn‚Äôt even ask why I am there instead took my ic and told me to seat down.

After I received my 4th booster vaccine, the elderly staff rudely gave me the acknowledgment slip and asked me to go off in a rude manner.

I don‚Äôt know whether this staff is having a bad day at work or what but this is not the way to behave toward the patient. I even wonder if this staff is given proper training to learn how to attend to patients especially elderly patients because some of them aren't familiar with the technology.

These staff should be laid off from their job if they aren't happy with their current job because patients are paying their salaries to begin in the first place.

my overall service experience here in this clinic excluding doctor lim is horrible. To the people reading this review, if you don't want to be treated rudely please don't visit this clinic.

title: Maruhachi - Donburi & Curry
name: Matthew Chan
text:
Our daughter has an uncanny ability to identify places to go for meals when we have no idea what is available nearby. We found an unlikely location for one of Maruhachi Donburi Curry branch stall at Block 671 Edgefield Plains! Even when you arrive by Google maps, you can hardly find it as it is located within the Happy hawkers food court under Block 671.
We were quite happy to find food satisfying and of excellent quality. We ordered the Ebi Fry curry rice and their signature Pork Katsu rice set. The Pork Katsu aka Tonkatsu cutlet was fried extra crispy on the outside, but exquisitely juicy amd tender on the side (see photo). It is comparable to those served at Ma Maison outlets, if not better! The miso soup and the cabbage salad topped with Japanese sesame dressing complemented the tonkatsu very well.
I hope Maruhachi will maintain their quality, especially at this outlet. Our meal was super satisfying!

title: Maruhachi - Donburi & Curry

text: Ordered Black Pork Katsudon. Below average rice quality, pork heavily marinated with black pepper, zero crunch   ( of coz I'm not talking about the part with "an egg" on top). The egg is suppose to accentuate the taste and honestly, there is no taste at all. Perhaps I should order their Teishoku since I'm so fussy üòÇüòÇ. Staff is less than welcoming but not rude. Overworked? I don't know. I'll try at another branch since they have expanded quite a bit. Atmosphere - food court so can't expect too much.

title: Suntec City

text:
CANCELLATION of membership without warning
*Warning* *Personal Views* Don't shopped here just because of the member benefits. Please read below.

Received a email from suntec+ team on 13th Aug that they will be requesting BANK CARD TRANSACTION STATEMENT on 6 Aug from me to prove that the transactions made on that day will made by me. Out of 11 transactions, 9 was charged to my card while the other 2 transaction, which i was unable to provide, as they were made by my companions, who went out with me.

Spent $20k within a year in Suntec but in the end was received this type of treatment. Really disappointed with their team. I hope the 'sudden investigation' were conducted to every Suntec member and not just to a selected/targeted "members". (Maybe i got $400+ worth of points)

On 16 Aug, received another email from Suntec team that my account has been cancelled due to "i earn points using relatives/friends purchases WITHOUT WARNING.

If you are reading this, you may be the next person. Think twice

name: lan nguyen
text: We come to this place quite number of times as it‚Äôs convenience and close to my office. The food is fine , table is comfy, the price for the dish size is valuable but the service is horrible. I used to be in the FnB industrial for more than 5 years and have been to some different restaurants, food central‚Ä¶and I‚Äôve never ever seen any other place in Singapore have this kind of service staffs. Over 4,5 staffs we often see around the floor and none of them able to greet customers properly, serve food to customers just bring to the table and place it on, even when they clear the empty plates they can‚Äôt even greet or ask for permission if we wish to have it clear, they come and go just silent like the robot. They serve the drinks: a bottle of beer without open it for customers just leave the opener on the table. Must be fair previous times they got open and leave the bottle on the table‚Ä¶üôÅ. I wish i can meet the manager or the owner and tell them if you really put intention to build this business then please at least train your staffs. Can‚Äôt expect for perfect service but at least basic service customer should require. when i type these words I don‚Äôt want to bring hate or make you less customers but i hope you will do something different and make it become a great place. ‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è

title: JING RAN RESTAURANT Á¨¨‰∫åÂÆ∂Âõ≠È§êÈ¶Ü
name: Adrian Fernandez
text:
Would recommend!

Tried a variety of dishes for dinner. They have a good spread of options, and the flavours striking in a way that speaks to their authenticity while being affordable.

Their dishes were great. The standout was the steamed sea bass, the fish was fresh, the texture was delicate but robust. Their vegetables were well seasoned, with stir fried beans crisp and flavourful. The egg and tomato was a simple dish but was no less satisfying.

Their food also did not shy away in the spice area, with the heat making a balanced roundness to the dishes without being overpowering. For those not well acquainted with spice, I‚Äôm sure they are amenable to requests to taper the kick. Though I do recommend it for the experience.

Service was prompt and attentive, complementing the dishes served. Would come again. They also have private rooms with KTV systems.

title: UNIQLO Waterway Point (Same Day Click & Collect)
name: oXRYSTALo Ong
text:
Uniqlo Waterway Point: A Great Shopping Experience with Excellent Customer Service (5/5 Stars)

Rating:

‚Ä¢ Product Selection: 5/5 (Great selection of Heattech items and other apparel)

‚Ä¢ Product Quality: 5/5 (Excellent quality Heattech and comfortable pants)

‚Ä¢ Customer Service: 5/5 (Exceptional service from Shyaf and Azrinah, especially Azrinah's patience and style advice)

‚Ä¢ Store Ambience: 4/5 (Well-organized and easy to navigate)

Overall: 5/5

I recently visited the Uniqlo store at Waterway Point (83 Punggol Central, #01-21, Singapore 828761) and had a fantastic shopping experience. I was particularly pleased with the selection of Heattech items. I picked up a navy blue Heattech Cotton Crew Neck T-Shirt, an off-white Heattech Cotton Crew Neck T-Shirt, and a pair of black Washable Knit Ribbed Pants (Co-ord) (Regular Length).  The quality of the Heattech is, as always, excellent, and the pants are incredibly comfortable.

The service I received from Shyaf and Azrinah was exceptional. Azrinah was especially patient and helpful, offering valuable style advice as I tried on different items.  Her assistance made my shopping experience much more enjoyable.

The store is well-organized and easy to navigate. I highly recommend this Uniqlo location for its great products and outstanding customer service. I'll definitely be back!

Very disappointed with inflexible sales/supervisor guy at this store.
I've been patronizing the store regularly, but today I really not being appreciated as loyal customer.
I bought a NON-discounted shirt for husband, paid at kiosk and registered my purchase in Uniqlo app. I did print the receipt, somehow I lost it somewhere, I do admit my mistake.
Just unfortunate I bought the wrong size and need to exchange it to smaller one, so back to the store.
To my surprise the guy simply reject my request, although he able to extract my receipt referring to my Uniqlo's app purchase history.
Told him I only asked to exchange size, not returning/refund, or exchange model. Eventhough the receipt was shown in his device but still he didn't even care how I explained it, he simply said it is system requires to have the original receipt.
It just too bad even supervisor no longer using human sense for customer relationship, simply dictated by system is all the guy can do. Not even offering help to further check with store's higher authority personnel.
So I decided to forget about this lame brand :)

title: Mamana Kitchen
name: theguy_withstuff
text: Mamana Kitchen has some stunningly wonderful food and I‚Äôm surprised they aren‚Äôt settled in a shopping mall or anything. I ordered some lemon tea and egg and waffles for breakfast and the lemon tea was sour BUT there was sugar syrup so I could make it sweet which is how I like it. The egg and waffles however were amazing. The egg was the weakest part but it was still rich and tasty, the waffles however were amazingly crunchy and the honey they provided supplemented this fact more. The cherry on top was the crunchy greens which were just nice with the sauce they used. The workers were cool and the place was well air conditioned and well cleaned with a toilet to add. In conclusion, amazing place, would come back for more.

title: Mamana Kitchen
name: nini
text:
I had a bad experience at Mamana Kitchen. While me, my son and my sister were dining in to try their breakfast menu, my son accidentally broke the table‚Äôs QR code. I informed and offered to pay for the damage when the lady (i assumed was the owner) served our food. However, HALFWAY through our meal, she accused my son of breaking it again, saying that her staff recognized my son and that he already broke it before which is untrue, as we hadn‚Äôt visited in over a month and QR codes weren‚Äôt even used then.

She insisted it was him despite our explanation, and gave a rude ‚Äúwarning‚Äù not to let it happen again. She also said the boy who broke it was at the outdoor seating, with only my son and my husband around. I asked my husband and he said there had been no such incident. She even told us that she would like us to visit again, so although he ‚Äúbroke‚Äù twice, we should be more vigilant. The way she gave a smirk, and insisted in her mind that it was my son without checking the cctv or to show any evidence made me extremely furious. When the owner left, I confronted the staff, she mentioned the incident she referred to happened INDOORS, and that clearly telling us that it wasn‚Äôt my son as our last visit, they haven‚Äôt introduced the QR code yet. The staff immediately apologized. She was helpful, and very apologetic and I was very thankful of that.

Being falsely accused like that, especially mid-meal, was upsetting and unprofessional. I didn‚Äôt even get to finish the food as I had no appetite after we got falsely accused. We definitely won‚Äôt be returning. Please review your evidence before making such accusations.

Upon ordering, drinks came after 10 mins of waiting. The beef ragu took ard 20 mins. And the Steak and Fries took a whopping 30 MINS WOW. Even more wonderful that it was thin and not flavourful. We had to flag down the waiter to ask for the brownie dessert but he kept ignoring us üòç took abt 10 tries to get his attention, and in the end, another waiter helped get the brownie for us.

Notes on the dishes:
Steak was thin. The sambal served with the steak was odd. It was weird with the sourdough and it was weird with the steak. Didn't know what to do with it. Beef ragu was okay. Drinks were okay. Brownie was about the size of my palm.

Total bill came to more than $90. Anna's Beef Ragu ($28), Hibiscus Bliss Frizz ($7), Orange Lychee Cooler ($8), Anna's Steak and Fries (medium, $28), Mochi Brownie with Sea Salt and Olive Oil (serve later, $6.33)

All prices do not include service charge of 10% and GST of 9%.

This caf√© offers a reasonably diverse selection of food and beverages. While the prices are somewhat elevated, this is understandable given its location within the Singapore National Gallery.

title: Courtyard Cafe, Changi Beach Club
name: D Y
text:
Unsafe & Poor Quality Utensils for Children!

Deeply concern & disappointed towards their poor quality of utensils used. The bowl used for my child's spaghetti from the kids meal ‚Äî was in extremely poor condition!

Look at the attached image - it was so badly scratched that I was genuinely alarmed. Scratched plastic, especially when used to serve hot food, can leach harmful chemicals into the meal. This is particularly worrying given that this bowl was clearly intended for children.

As a proud Singaporean dining in one of our most established tourist attractions, I expect caf√©s to uphold the highest standards of hygiene & safety, especially when serving meals to young children! The use of such degraded and potentially hazardous tableware is absolutely unacceptable.

Ensuring safe, clean & food-safe materials should be a non-negotiable standard for any food establishment.

name: Martin Low
text:
We came on a Sunday night with 5pax and ordered the set menu for 4 + some add ons.

Hits: the curry fish head, sambal lala and dual method kailan were great. cereal prawns were good too but note that it is shelled. The sauces paired well with rice.

Misses: the tom yam soup was way too salty to the point that is barely edible.

Service: food came relatively fast. Order by QR and pay at counter.

Price: Just about what I expected for zichar.

Atmosphere: the indoor seating is very well air conditioned. The outdoor seating is decently cooled by fan, and you can see cooks preparing otah. However, expect insects flying around and on the table as it is within the Park after all.

Overall, it was a decent experience for zichar, though familiarity with what's good would be ideal.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Fabien Sieh
text:
I have been bringing my daughter to this clinic since she was just 2 months old. Dr. Goh is exceptionally knowledgeable and consistently shows great empathy‚Äînot only toward my daughter but also to us as parents. During every consultation, she is patient, caring, and never in a rush, unlike some others who may seem more focused on volume than quality of care.

As for the counter staff, they are generally kind and helpful. While there may be one who comes across as a little eccentric, it does not take away from the fact that this is a very good clinic. I trust the care provided here, and will continue bringing my daughter whenever we need a reliable and compassionate paediatrician.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: ken neo
text: Very good in diagnosing. Excellent doctor.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Khidir Hanafi
text: ‚ÄúDr. Goh and the team were excellent. The lady at the front desk was kind and welcoming. Dr. Goh explained my baby‚Äôs condition clearly and thoroughly. Even when I asked questions outside the main issue, she took the time to explain and provide detailed advice. Truly appreciated!‚Äù

name: May Lim
text: My go to neighbourhood PD. Dr is friendly and patient

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Jill Bread Stick
text:
Been here so many times, spend so much each time $200 plus, no matter how my child take KidsHealth medicine it NEVER recover, always need a 2nd visit, waste $$ waste time!!

They even anyhow upsell a bigger bottle of dolphin nose spray, when I‚Äôm not with my elderly mom during payment. Old lady at counter, also very rude & rough.. with my kid. UnTill I gave up & let my 2 years old toddler try next door, (Universal medical Clinic), their medicine one time works! Old male doctor clinic don‚Äôt anyhow upsell medicine, very reasonable charges, after the switch no regrets after!!! Choose your child clinic very wisely please!! Many unethical doctors around.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic

text: Bad experience from reception counter. When I called they insisted to walk in but when walked in they are not considering the phone call as appointment..will not visit here again.

The doctor is good but the reception staffs are rude and no manner especially is the younger. We are come here for see doctor and not see ur all black face.
The waiting is very long and we are so tired as we no sleep for few days as our girl is sick badly. But still need face this kind of person.. Who want to come clinic if no sick.

name: Mr Chris
text: Pd very attentive to our needs. Thank you for the medication that helps our boy to eat today. The clinic is closing 16/12-21/12.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Wei Ling Lim
text:
Dr. Goh at KidsHealth Paediatric Centre is very kind and caring. She is consultative, always sharing with us ways to take care of ourselves and what to look out for. We're grateful for her professionalism and dedication shown during every visit!

Her clinic is one of the few paediatric clinics in yishun area, so it is extremely popular and always has a queue. Expect to wait about 2 hours or so during peak periods. Do come early if your child was not well, or have someone queue up first. Bring your stroller along if your child was not well as there's not many seats available.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Zhaivoronok Alona
text:
Iwas looking for children pediatric and found it  in this clinic. I like that doctor explanes everything. Not just this for runing nose, this for caugh and etc. Doctor explaned what it could be. How we are going to treat it. And what I should look at if something go wrong.
There is play corner, so my 2 kids were busy playing while we were waiting our turn.
What I also liked is new renovation and clean place.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Elyn Yeo
text: I would like to express my deepest gratitude to Dr. Goh for the exceptional care provided to my 2 children since they are born. Dr. Goh has been incredibly helpful and patient throughout our numerous visits. Her extensive knowledge and expertise were crucial in diagnosing and addressing my child‚Äôs frequent sensitive airways. Dr. Goh not only solved the problem but also offered valuable advice for ongoing care and prevention. Additionally, her team of nurses has been friendly, helpful, and professional, making our experience even more positive. We are truly thankful for the outstanding medical support and compassionate approach of Dr. Goh and her team. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Sharon Tan
text: We had been seeing Dr Goh since #1 was a baby till now (4+yrs old) and #2 also went there even we had moved to east side. Dr Goh is detailed, knowledgeable and patience even her clinic staff. She shared holistic ways of healing and treating too.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Tan Agnes
text:
We have been seeing Dr. Goh for our first born till now the third child healthcare needs for the past 11 years, and our experience has been overwhelmingly positive. Dr. Goh is not only highly knowledgeable and professional but also remarkably compassionate.

For the front counter nurses, We are grateful for their dedication and the positive impact they‚Äôve had on our child‚Äôs care. Their professionalism and kindness make them stand out, and we highly recommend them to any family in need of pediatric care.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Lisa Goh
text:
We‚Äôve been bringing both our 5-year-old and 10-month-old sons to KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic in Yishun, and our experience has been nothing short of exceptional. Dr. Goh is incredibly kind and caring, always taking the time to address our concerns with patience and clarity. She explains medical matters in simple, easy-to-understand terms, which is so reassuring as a parent.

The front staff, especially Jasmine, are professional and extremely helpful. The clinic's design is thoughtful, with both an air-conditioned waiting area and a spacious open-air waiting area. This segregation is particularly considerate, as some parents may prefer not to stay in an enclosed space when their child is unwell.

I was especially impressed by an instance where I witnessed Jasmine during triage. She quickly noticed that a child had an extremely high fever and immediately checked with the parent to administer a dose of ibuprofen. Her quick action and attentiveness made all the difference.

Overall, KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic offers outstanding care and service. We‚Äôre grateful to have found such a wonderful place for our children‚Äôs healthcare needs.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Fatin Fatihah Kasmani
text: From front staff to Dr Goh herself, they have been exceptionally helpful and good. I can see that they work hard to make sure everyone is attended to. And Dr Goh is detailed and knowledgeable. She shared holistic ways of healing and treating too. Thank you

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: sook tan
text: First time visiting this clinic and unfortunately, encountered three very rude staff members. No matter how skilled the doctor, a nurse with an attitude can ruin the experience. This clinic is a lost cause.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: acuppakopi
text:
Multiple visits here for the past 4 years, being a mom of 3.

Doctor has always been helpful, detailed and patient dealing with queries and cranky children. Medicines works as intended and so far I do not have any experience of follow-up visit because child was still unwell, thankful for that.

Nurses/counter staff, in my experience, have been great. Gentle with my girls, and kind but some doesn't look as approachable. Not an issue though.

The queueing system, however, has not changed for the past few years. Snaking queues, long waiting hours; I had to be "kiasu" enough to reach as early as 7:30am to "chope" my place just to avoid +++ waiting time. Once, we were third in line but had to make way for appointment basis visit, followed by 2 others which took more than an hour to wait (from opening time) ‚Äî with sick cranky kids it's a chore.

Previously during covid days, the nurses were quite strict on number of people waiting in the clinic (which to me was good honestly given the small space); but on my recent visit, most of the them were waiting inside. It gets a little chaotic though with all the sick, crying kids and tight space. There's some toys prepared for the kids too.

Payable by CDA. Not sure what other payment method accepted.

On better days, I get to have breakfast nearby first while waiting; the nurse will give a call when you're 3rd in line so there's ample time to head back.

I'd recommend for non urgent visits; and if you have more time to spare. Otherwise, GP/polyclinic may be a better option.

Despite all these, my number one choice will still be the GP right across my block for convenience (though we've had 2nd visit issues cause of unsuitable meds). Its much cheaper too. Hahaha.

title: KidsHealth Paediatric Clinic
name: Gan
text:
We visited Dr Goh because our 6 month old still had phlegm after catching a cold almost 3 weeks ago.

Similar to most paediatric clinics that we've visited, KidsHealth accepts appointments and limits walk-ins. They were also very clear that the wait for walk-ins might be 1-2hrs. This was acceptable for us as we have not seen any paediatric clinics with little or no waiting required for walk-ins.

We were thankful for the coffeeshop that allowed us to wait for 2hrs with a full tummy.

Will strongly suggest to visit a normal family clinic if your child is older, or if the symptoms are mild.

title: West Point Clinic
name: Dave Soh
text:
Clinic has been freshly renovated.
Doctor is friendly and communicates well with patient.
One of the best family doctor and highly recommended

title: West Point Clinic
name: jerome micheal
text: Good

title: West Point Clinic
name: Kai Ting Ng
text:
My family and I would like to extend our deepest thanks to Dr. Chuang Wei Ping for his exceptional care and attentiveness.

During my father‚Äôs visit on 30 April, Dr. Chuang picked up on something subtle and recommended an ECG, something my father hadn‚Äôt even thought necessary at the time.

That simple, precautionary step turned out to be life-changing. The ECG revealed clogged arteries, and even the hospital doctors later remarked how lucky it was we came in when we did‚Äîjust in time to prevent what could have been a major heart attack.

We‚Äôre beyond grateful for Dr. Chuang‚Äôs sharp eye, medical intuition, and genuine concern.

Thank you, Dr. Chuang.

title: West Point Clinic
name: Alex See
text: Very effective n efficient n polite very knowledgeable educated doctor

title: West Point Clinic
name: Jason Tan
text: Very bad experience for my first time visit. Clinic was run down, consultation room was messy with a lot of antique stuff. Doctor has his own medical condition and sitting on wheelchair, deemed unfit. The consultation lasted 10 minutes and less than 3 minutes were spent checking on my mum. Wasted $98 for a MC and a few medication. Highly recommend to avoid this clinic. Doctor even told us not to go at that timing because it is closing time, not good. As if we can control when we fall sick and when we have to see a doctor.

title: West Point Clinic
name: Edwin Buddy
text: Minimum $90 consultation charge

title: West Point Clinic
name: Li Chow Tang
text:
I have known Dr Chuang since the time I was studying at NTU, which was about thirty years ago. When my wife struggled with a condition for many weeks, there wasn‚Äôt anyone else I trust more to help her. We drove all the way from Hougang to Jurong West.

I trust Dr Chuang because he goes about his profession with the same beliefs I hold dear to. I am trained to uncover the root cause as an engineer, before designing a solution. As an experienced HR practitioner, I do not prescribe approaches that address symptoms. One easy but wrong way is to throw training at an employee when the harder right is to give him or her the unpleasant but truthful feedback. Few want and dare to do what‚Äôs necessary to help others.

I once asked Dr Chuang why he chose to be a GP when he is a world renowned specialist. He told me he injured his hand and could no longer be a surgeon. He is different from many doctors so many will see him as unorthodox and think he‚Äôs wrong when he‚Äôs not.

My wife got the significant and sustained treatment we were looking for. Hope you have a clearer idea of how I see Dr Chuang now.

title: West Point Clinic
name: GT Mah
text: I drove all the way from Tengah to this clinic to see this doctor

title: West Point Clinic

title: Richton Cafe Pte Ltd
name: Dan P
text:
Richton Caf√© is a hidden gem conveniently located below an HDB block in Pasir Ris, making it a great spot for a quick and satisfying lunch fix. The caf√© offers an impressive variety of affordable and reasonably priced dishes, catering to different cravings. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for Mee Goreng, Chicken Cutlet Rice, Hongkong Mee, Hor Fun, Mui Fun, Popcorn Chicken, Yong Tau Foo, Fried Bee Hoon, or Kway Teow, there‚Äôs always something to choose from.

One of the highlights of this caf√© is its indoor air-conditioned dining area, which provides a comfortable escape from the heat. However, seating is quite limited, especially during weekday lunch hours, so it‚Äôs best to come early or be prepared for a short wait. Despite the crowd, the service is efficient, and orders are usually prepared quite fast, making it a convenient option for those on a tight schedule.

A standout for me is their sambal chili‚Äîflavorful with just the right amount of spice, enhancing many of their dishes perfectly. It‚Äôs the kind of place that serves no-frills, hearty meals, ideal for a casual and fuss-free lunch.

If you‚Äôre in the Pasir Ris area and looking for a budget-friendly, tasty, and quick meal, Richton Caf√© is definitely worth a visit!

*However do note that there is no toilet üöæ there but there is hand-wash basin at the side.

title: Outram Community Hospital (OCH)
name: Xin Hao
text:
I visited a loved one at Outram Community Hospital and was very impressed by the overall environment and care provided. The hospital is clean, modern, and thoughtfully designed, creating a calm and welcoming space for both patients and visitors. Carpark is also well organized with sufficient parking lots.

What stood out most was the professionalism and warmth of the staff ‚Äî from nurses to therapists to admin personnel. Everyone was patient, respectful, and genuinely caring in how they interacted with the patients. It gave me a lot of reassurance seeing my loved one so well looked after.

Facilities were well-maintained given its newly opened as well and visiting hours were managed smoothly. There are also great amenities - Koufu food court, POSB ATM, AXS machine, starbucks, Koi, and a pharmacy. Pretty decent for a community hospital.

A great example of community healthcare done right unlike some others i have visited. Thank you to the team at Outram Community Hospital for your dedication and compassion.

text: I highly recommend Dr. Lim Yinjia for her exceptional TCM expertise and genuine care. She takes the time to understand your unique body constitution, provides accurate diagnoses, and prescribes tailored herbal treatments. Her thoughtful and effective approach has significantly improved my overall health. Her patience and professionalism make every consultation reassuring. title: NTU Chinese Medicine Clinic
name: Liv Go
text: I have a great concern over the non response of the main investigator Dr Zhong Lidan. As I have queries over the recent study put up by NTU-TCM department, I raised queries with the researcher, Mr Peter Lim who was not able to address my concerns. A contact number to the TCM clinic was provided for me to reach out to Dr Zhong but I was told by the clinic that is not a number to reach the main investigator. After I feedback to Mr Peter Lim, he did not offer me a direct email to Dr Zhong. I found Dr Zhong‚Äôs email and wrote her an urgent mail for her to respond. She did not attend to my email since Wednesday, 23/4/25. Due to the non response I emailed QSM of NTU yet my email was also unattended. There was also no follow-up effort from Mr Peter Lim although the issue was as important as the handling of patient‚Äôs urine specimen. There was no offer of help from Mr Lim to help reach out to Dr Zhong. I hope the overall in charge of NTU could help reach out to me or get either of them to respond to my concerns.

I suggest you don't come alone, if it is your first visit and you don't speak Chinese. It wasn't pleasant and professional handling from the doctor, I felt very exposed and excluded. This clinic has some of the best physicians I have ever met.

Dr Lau Kah Yong was the first person to accurately determine what was causing my insomnia as I had insomnia for 2 months before I met him. After 2 weeks of treatment, I managed to slowly improve and I was able to fall asleep more regularly from then on. I have went to multiple TCM physicians and doctors before I met him, none of their treatments worked.

Dr Yong Choon Lian and Dr Lim Yin Jia are also very caring and they also really do their best to help their patients and are willing to go the extra mile for them.

The front desk is also very friendly. They do their best to make sure you remember your appointments and help to schedule you in.

10/10 would recommend.

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: Brina Chia
text:
Don‚Äôt tell people to put wheelchair outside hallway for public use when they still need it. You know how hard it is to find another in the other floors beside entrance? If the patients need the wheelchair they would‚Äôve got the chair before they entered.

I visited the hospital with my grandma today and when she went in for her treatment, I waited for her outside and decided to wheel the empty wheelchair to an area with seat.

An older nurse stop me and ask that I placed the wheel chair outside. I said my grandma still wants to use the wheel chair as she‚Äôll only be inside for a short while, but she still insisted I put it outside so everyone can use.

Can you for the love of god use your head and understand the reason why it‚Äôs a dumb idea to ask patient to put wheel chair outside the hallway? There is literally no wheelchair outside especially when there is a lot of visitors. Why do you think all of us are bringing the wheelchair with us whenever we go?

If I put it outside ‚Äúfor someone to use‚Äù and they take the wheel chair, I need to go all the way to the ground floor because that‚Äôs the only place I know where to get wheel chair. If my grandmother alone came here, she put out then how? Can‚Äôt find the wheel chair and ask her go all the way first floor to get?? If my grandfather came instead, he need go all the way to the first floor. You only want young people to accompany patient is it?

Trouble another nurse to get wheelchair all the way from first floor? I‚Äôm sure they don‚Äôt exactly know where to find wheel chairs either in the other floor. It‚Äôs near impossible because I also had to find wheelchair in the other floor before.

You know I‚Äôm honestly applaud and offended, like if this was my grandmother I don‚Äôt think she even knows where to find the wheel chair after she put outside. And is it even necessary to tell us this? If you have limited wheelchairs I understand, but I visited the hospital and there are numerous wheelchairs outside the entrance ground floor. It comes off as a little too insensitive and stuck up. Also why am I the only one who was told this?? She never even tell the other older visitors who are accompanying the patient. When my mother came to me she immediately stop what she said and left?? Just because I‚Äôm a young person doesn‚Äôt mean I won‚Äôt put up a bad review or complaint.

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: Nursa Daud
text: Messed up queueing system. Departments blaming each other when the queue number doesn't move from their side. Patients have to take note and be alert that sometimes your queue number is stuck somewhere and not moving. Side note: even though being given an appointment timing, they are never punctual.

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: David Lee
text:
Update: Since my last visit, the food area has expanded. Good job, NCCS.

The new NCCS building is an upgrade to the old building. An area to improve is the food area as seats are limited and are fully occupied during the couple of times I have been there. Difficult to find a vacant seat.

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: Hamda Kazim
text:
‚ú® A heartfelt thank you to Dr. David and Dr. Brian ‚ú®

As a medical professional myself, I can genuinely say that meeting Dr. David, my father‚Äôs oncologist at Singapore National Cancer Centre (NCCS), has been one of the most inspiring experiences in this journey.

From the very first appointment, I could see his depth of knowledge, professionalism, and compassion. His clinical judgment is exceptional ‚Äî calm, clear, and deeply reassuring. I‚Äôve learned so much just by being in the room with him during my father‚Äôs visits.

Despite being told in Dubai that my father might have a new cancer, Dr. David‚Äôs expertise helped reveal that this was not the case. His careful review and insight proved that the earlier findings were incorrect ‚Äî and for that, my entire family is deeply grateful. I‚Äôm truly happy I traveled all the way from Dubai for this opinion and treatment. It was absolutely worth it.

I also want to thank Dr. Brian, my father‚Äôs surgeon at Singapore General Hospital, for his excellent care and support throughout this process.

Thank you, Dr. David and Dr. Brian ‚Äî you have both made a profound difference in our lives. Looking forward to seeing you again in three months, insha‚ÄôAllah.

With heartfelt appreciation,

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: Shi Min Zhu
text:
Appointment was at 1030am, got to meet the oncologist only at 1.15pm.
Patient is in his final stage of cancer/life and made to wait on wheelchair for hours. DO BETTER SGH.

I won't go for anymore treatment again if cancer relapse. Because this place is adding more stress to my life, instead of helping me. Good at pushing here and there.

text: Fix the damn function of the lifts, all 6 lifts arent even working properly. I can be on the 10th floor and the lift being on the lower floor goes up to the 9th floor thinking it will come to the 10th floor so that I can go down but it then comes up to the 9th floor then goes down from 9th floor, and while waiting for that lift that didnt pick me all the other lifts arent even coming. Same for which ever level especially level 1. I visit here every week so I dare the person who build this nonsense of a lift to come try it out to see what I'm talking about.

I placed order for wanton noodle value meal $3.50 because my dad has no appetite but needed to eat something. The young lady boss asked me a general question ( if I wanted char sao), my dad replied yes and in the end up paid $6.50. When I asked them to say clearly next time, the young man argue back rudely and said I should said value meal. But the value meal is also wan ton soup so I did not say wrongly. They charged so expensive and are very rude. In the end, my dad did not finish the $6.50 noodle. I could have reject the meal but I didn‚Äôt.

I learnt something. Next time must say ‚Äòvalue meal‚Äô

Here I very thank to the person who found my wallet, and thank to the national cancer center level 13 staff return my wallet with no missing items.

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: Elsie Seah
text:
I have just received a letter from my health insurer approving my claim for Chemotherapy done in Aug 2022 at National Cancer Centre. Although I did visit the centre in Aug 2022, I never had any Chemotherapy treatment. Why did National Cancer Centre submit a claim on my behalf when there was never such a treatment? What is going on with the administration?

UPDATE
Thanks to the speedy clarification by Mac Quek Chuan Keng of NCCS, my faith in NCCS has been restored.

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: Scott Ward
text: Amazing space and location being connected to the MRT. Staff is incredibly focused on the care of the patients.

title: Outram Community Hospital (OCH)
name: GW Ong
text:
My father‚Äôs health was rapidly declining due to recurring dizziness and nausea episodes, and his recovery journey was initially very challenging. However, we are very grateful for the care he received at Outram Community Hospital, particularly from the team at Ward 9A.
I did not expect that my father could be discharged soon, but under the team led by Dr. Choo and along with the physio team supported by the incredibly warm assistant Mei Ling, he made significant progress on his physical condition. We were also fortunate to have the support of Dr. Tan Chieh Suey from SGH, who provided his expertise and advice for his recovery.
Our stay was made significantly more pleasant thanks to Nurse Leong Kai Man, whose experience and insight were invaluable. We are also grateful to the other dedicated nurses, including Zhou Yuhang; Ms. Lai, the dietitian, has also given us her thoughtful nutritional advice.
We would also like to extend our appreciation to the healthcare assistants, many of whom we didn‚Äôt have the chance to get their names, for their consistent support and kindness throughout our stay.

title: Outram Community Hospital (OCH)
name: Von Karman Tsien
text:
Some of the staffs are good but some of staffs are very bad and have attitude problems! When you tell them something they either stop you or retort that you abuse them and complain to the doctors! Of course the doctor here will side them.  Some of them can‚Äôt understand simple English or refuse to communicate with you and understand your problems!  They always play the Trump Card ‚Äú Don‚Äôt abuse our staffs or we will call the security!‚Äù
Let‚Äôs face it who wants to be hospitalized? Respect should be both ways traffic, who wants to misuse or abuse your staffs?
Maybe most of them are from third world countries and they have been abused and misused by their own country people! By the way, they are here as salary health workers and not as Red Cross Nightingale Volunteers!  We respect their human rights but please don‚Äôt abuse our trust and respect of their human rights!
People just want to get rehabilitated and get out of hospital fast! A decent healthy person with self respected stomach will definitely avoid the hospital like a plague!!!  And it is not FREE!

title: Outram Community Hospital (OCH)

text: My mom was warded at OCH after an operation at SGH.  As she was bed bound.. they wanted to weigh her using a lifting machine.. nurses supported her shoulders and hips..leaving her head n neck dangling..my mom was shouting for her dear life thinking she was going to fall head down.. nurses didn't bother to explain nor lift her head. They dutifully weighed her in spite of her screaming in fear.. put her down . Without a word.. all the nurse said was 53kg!!

text: Having live piano music while waiting for blood test at the Clinical Laboratory at level 10 is very nice touch by the hospital.   Good effort by the hospital.   Is the pianist paid or a volunteer?

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: Florence M Tan
text:
I am truly grateful for the excellent care provided by the National Cancer Centre Singapore (NCCS). From the very start, the process has been structured and well-organized. Everything, from making appointments to registration, medication prescriptions, and treatment, is handled efficiently.

The orientation for newcomers is very helpful, and I appreciate the thoughtful details like offering home delivery for medication at no extra charge. NCCS also provides comprehensive cancer support services, including call and clinic support for managing side effects and mental health advice, which has been incredibly valuable throughout the treatment journey.

The nursing team here provides exceptional support that, in many instances, can be better than what one might experience with private specialists. Their dedication and professionalism truly stand out. Though not all hospitals are perfect, NCCS does their best in ensuring patients feel supported and cared for. They also encourage continuous improvement by asking for online feedback after every visit.

Even though mask requirements have been lifted, I still wear one to protect myself, especially when there's news about flu bugs. The accessibility of the center is also a plus‚Äîit's a short walk to the SGH cafeteria, which is handy when the caf√© on Level 2 is crowded or when I prefer other food options.

I want to extend my heartfelt thanks to the oncologists, pharmacists, and nurses who have cared for me throughout this year. Your dedication and expertise make all the difference.

title: National Cancer Centre Singapore
name: YL
text: My heartfelt appreciation to NCCS Staff Rose which extend her kindness and hospitality to us including my elderly father who does not speak English for his medical appt. She went the extra mile and comforted us with her kindness and smile during our first visit. Thank you very much Rose you definitely deserve an award.

title: NTU Chinese Medicine Clinic
name: Rach
text:
Have been a patient of Dr Zhao Yan (ËµµÂåªÂ∏à) since the first time I saw her back in 2016. I came back to see her 2.5 years ago and have been regularly taking TCM meds, while undergoing monthly acupuncture treatment in the past few months. Acupuncture has been quite effective for me so far in relieving of my cramps and reducing blood clots, but I believe consistency is key to maintaining its effectiveness.

Am grateful most of all to have found an empathetic, personable, kind, caring, patient and helpful doctor who has always made me feel comfortable and at ease when sharing somewhat private details of my health issues, to best receive the most appropriate line of medical treatment. Dr Zhao is also professional and appears humble despite her seniority in the TCM field over years of experience. This makes me look forward to each consultation and treatment session with her, knowing I‚Äôm in good hands.üôÇü•∞üíØ

Personally, I would recommend NTU TCM clinic for those seeking TCM treatment in a clean, bright and aesthetically pleasing environment! Prices are quite reasonable compared to other clinics I‚Äôve been to too.

text: We loved this coffee place! Located near the hawker centre, the staff were absolutely lovely and attentive. Great coffee, very good pastries (which were warmed up for us) and really cool vibes. We loved that everything (including the ceiling lamps!) were made from bicycles. Would recommend.

text: Super cool cafe in the middle of Changi Village, well worth a stop if you are in the area. Waffles were excellent, as were the gelatos. Cones were crunchy and yummy. Brownie was good. Not a coffee person, but it smelled good ! The space is decorated with lots of cycling gear, cool place to chill for a couple of hours !

text:
Absolutely disappointed with the medical care at Central 24-HR Clinic (Pioneer North). My sister had a deep cut wound, and the nurse was kind enough to let her see the doctor quickly. But Dr. Andrew barely looked at her injury, didn‚Äôt examine it properly, and impatiently wrapped it with brown dressing‚Äîso tightly that her finger turned purple.

He dismissed it as minor, saying it would heal in a week. Thankfully, my parents didn‚Äôt feel right and took her to A&E. There, the hospital doctor said the wound was deep enough to see the bone, required an X-ray and five stitches, and even commented that the dressing used at the clinic is no longer recommended.

This clinic visit could have led to serious complications if we hadn‚Äôt sought a second opinion. Very poor judgment, no empathy, and unacceptable care.

name: Joyce Do
text:
Im leaving this feedback to express my dissatisfaction with the service I received at the clinic.

I visited the clinic with my husband and we registered at 6.15 PM. The lady counter staff informed us that the doctor would start seeing patients at 6.30 PM. My husband was running a fever and feeling very unwell, so we politely asked if we could sit on the waiting chairs while waiting just 15 more minutes? However, the lady counter staff firmly replied, "No."
I was shocked by the lack of empathy and professionalism. Is this really how you treat patients who are clearly unwell and in need of care? It‚Äôs not just about policy,  its about basic humanity pls.

Moreover, the waiting time was excessively long. Even after the doctor started at 6.30 PM, we were still waiting as patient number 5 at 7.30 PM, while patient number 4 was still inside with the doctor.

I sincerely hope the clinic takes this feedback seriously and makes an effort to improve both the attitude of the front-desk staff and the efficiency of your services. Patients come to a clinic for help ‚Äî not to be treated coldly and made to wait in discomfort. There are already many negative reviews about this clinic, and I now understand why. I believe others had similar real experiences like ours. It‚Äôs not just people being harsh ‚Äî it‚Äôs because they were genuinely disappointed and upset.

title: Healthway Medical (Jurong West)
name: Germaine Chooi
text:
Went to this clinic out of the usual family clinic i always visited since i was a baby due to extreme rashes from my body. The usual clinic is too packed and need advance booking. Decided to go forward with a faster alternative instead.

Doctor took a torchlight to look at my rashes and insist that he wanted me to take off my shorts (with undies on), calling in with a female assistant to look at my rash on my buttock area. Just FYI - I have rash all over my body. Including outer thighs, arms, elbows. Of all places he wants to see those that were inside clothing. Asked questions that seemed grey ‚Äúdo i always wear this type of undies‚Äù - could be checking if i am allergic to cloth material. Pulling my undies a little near to my middle to see rashes. And also pulling up my top a little to see my back if there were rashes before i could allow him to. Asked a few inappropriate questions. Without thinking much i answered all his questions.

Gist of the story: he diagnosed was that i am infested with mites/ lice called scabies. He prescribed a few low dosage itch pills to stop the itch. But was ineffective. Gave me a prescription to go to the local pharmacy to get a lotion for lice & mites treatment. To be applied from neck to the feet for 3 days.

Today: I visited my usual GP and she said it was just heat rash & eczema flaring up from the hot weather. If it was lice/ mites with that lotion it would‚Äôve already stopped itching and cleared up already. Spent a total of $57.35 + $15 for lotion. The medication was also deemed ineffective due to the low dosage. Not showing any effects of relieving itch too.

Doctor asked me twice about if i needed an Mc. I said no. He proceeded to ask me what do i work as (not needed to answer actually). Yes i do not need an MC but i need to cure my rashes and itch. It seemed like this clinic is just good at giving MC for people who tend to chao geng but not for serious health matters. If a much accurate diagnosis of my rash could be given i wouldn‚Äôt be going to another round to the doctor again.

** Dr attended: Locum (written on my receipt)

text:
I wanted to do blood test in the morning with the overnight starving for at least 10 hrs. Reached there at 8.30 am and when reached counter for registration, it was about 9 am. Quite a number of people q before me. I got no. 17.

The best part came. When reached 10 am, only reached no. 7. I was starved badly and I gave up my blood test. I went to ask for my medicine instead. Waiting until 10.15 am, my medicine still not prepared. Then I went for my breakfast because seriously cannot taban already. After I back from my breakfast around 10.30 am, the q no. was only 10. Then the doctor saw my request for medicine. She refused to give the medicine just like that and asked the nurse to take my blood pressure and until I met her in her room by cutting the q. After a short consultation, I left the clinic at 11.30 am and it has not reached no. 17.

Just think about I need to starve to do the blood test. If follow today's time, I need to wait until at least 12 pm. I will be starving for my breakfast and lunch and DO NOTHING but just wait there. I don't understand why took so long for a patient to do the blood test and how come the q no so slow. If understaff or lack of doctor, please out front to inform and don't let people like me starving for so long and waiting for so long.

Very disappointed today, despite I got the good consultation previously from the doctors. My time can't be wasted just like that.

title: Healthway Medical (Jurong West)
name: Kenny Lim
text:
This morning intend to take medicine only but one of the Malay young staff attitude make me surprise, bcos I had been taking this medicine from this outlet for so many years , n I just mention wan to take medicine only but he not even ask me what medicine or not even wan to ask the doctor opinion str8  reject me say cannot take medicine, must c doctor‚Ä¶ so I dunno either the rules already change or what, but at least he need to explain the reason since totally not patient at tat time, lucky there is another Malay girl staff there n help me to check n confirm with doctor, she call me after checking say doctor agree to issue the medicine,.
Anyway not complain but just feedback, bcos we r not familiar with the clinic operation, sometime when some rules change pls explain to patient to prevent some misunderstanding.. sorry and thanks..

Came here as it was one of the recommended places to get matcha. It was terrible. The first cup was a cup of milk with a hint of matcha. But props to the team for being reactive and made a new cup for us, it was slightly better, but the brewing method is just wrong, which led to clumps of matcha powder in my drink.

Please invest in a matcha whisk, or if you're planning to use the milk frother, whisk your matcha in a bowl, or anything with a round base and make sure its all well dissolved. Sifting the matcha would help too.

I now almost always take the queue number ended up eating some other restaurant instead. Hated the queue so much so till no longer intend to visit this cafe anymore. They also close early at 9pm making having dinner here also very rushed.. I see the owner has no intention to improve the situation..

title: Rise & Grind Coffee Co.
name: Frederick Tan
text:
Rise & Grind Coffee Co.: A Promising Spot for Business Lunch with Room for Refinement

I chose Rise & Grind Coffee Co. for a recent business lunch, drawn by its reputation as a comfortable cafe. The setting was certainly pleasant, offering a relaxed and suitable environment for a midday meeting.

For my meal, I ordered the Pork Chop with Black Pepper Sauce. I must commend the kitchen on the marinade, which was clearly well-executed and delivered good flavour. However, I found the pork chop itself to be overcooked, resulting in a texture that was a little too tough. The long black I had was decent, serving its purpose as a coffee but not particularly standing out in its flavour profile.

In terms of service, it was okay. I noticed that a few tables required prompting before the crew came over to clean them, which felt a bit less proactive than I would have liked. On a prior note, the booking experience was not as smooth as it could have been, with the payment gateway presenting a bit of a challenge.

While the food and service were acceptable, there are certainly areas for improvement. A more attentive approach to table maintenance and a smoother booking process would enhance the overall experience. The pork chop has great potential, and with a little more care in the cooking, it could be a truly excellent dish.

Overall, Rise & Grind Coffee Co. is a fine choice for a casual business lunch due to its atmosphere. However, I hope they can refine their operational processes and consistency in the kitchen to better match their comfortable setting.

There also a lot of old school fruit tart and cakes at a reasonable price as well as kaya toast with eggs and kopi to go with.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Benjamin Chen
text:
I think this is one of the more well-known caf√©s in the area. The atmosphere is great ‚Äî very family-friendly, especially with the playground for kids. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a solid four-star caf√© overall, but I‚Äôm giving five stars today to support them, as my dinner experience was peaceful and comfortable.

Their salmon pasta always sets me on fire ‚Äî it‚Äôs the main reason I keep coming back! The sauce is creamy, and the salmon is perfectly cooked. I also tried the lamb burger, but it wasn‚Äôt really my type‚Ä¶ especially the bun. Not sure how to describe it ‚Äî maybe not fluffy enough? Honestly, even McD‚Äôs Angus burger buns might be better (JK!).

Thankfully, I also ordered the truffle cheese fries ‚Äî not the best I‚Äôve had, but still very tasty, nicely seasoned, and had a good truffle aroma.

We didn‚Äôt manage to try the desserts because we were too full from the mains ‚Äî which shows the portion sizes are quite generous, and pricing feels reasonable.

I noticed other customers sharing one salmon pasta and pairing it with fries or dessert ‚Äî honestly, that‚Äôs a smart way to enjoy more variety without over-ordering.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Joey Ter
text: Visited this restaurant recently and was quite disappointed. The staff were not very polite, which affected the overall experience. The food was just average ‚Äî nothing special in terms of taste. For the price charged, I expected a lot more, especially since the environment didn‚Äôt reflect the high cost either. Definitely not worth the value.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: R ‚ÄúIsabelle‚Äù sayshello

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Isabelle Goh
text: The recent dining experience was upsetting. The quality of the food has noticeably declined; the salmon pasta was excessively buttery and oily, leading to discomfort. The spring pancake and fried chicken were also overly oily, and the meat was tough, strawberry matcha was underwhelming. The overall dining environment was also unfavorable, characterized by a hot and stuffy atmosphere and an unstable table, despite a reservation for corner seating. We would definitely not come back anymore and not recommend to our family and friends.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.

Food wise, everything was nice but nothing spectacular. Good thing was they were served fast. Service was ok.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: shamirah natasha
text:
I visited Apricus Coffee during a non-peak period, thinking I could enjoy a cup of coffee while waiting for my friends to arrive. Upon entering, none of the staff greeted me, which was a bit odd given it wasn‚Äôt busy. I decided to take a seat at the bar stools near the entrance and cashier. The staff looked occupied, so I didn‚Äôt mind the lack of attention at first.

About 5 minutes later, a staff member approached me and asked if I was waiting for a table. I explained that I was waiting for friends and thought I‚Äôd have a coffee in the meantime. She then asked if I had a reservation, which caught me off guard‚ÄîI wasn‚Äôt aware one was needed. I replied honestly, saying I didn‚Äôt know. She then asked what time my friends would arrive, and when I said around 6:30‚Äì7:00pm, she told me there would be a crowd coming at 7pm.

At that point, I felt uncomfortable and slightly offended‚Äîwas I being indirectly told to leave? I reassured her that I just wanted to have my coffee and would leave before the crowd came. I ended up ordering my coffee and leaving shortly after.

While I understand if there were upcoming reservations, the way it was communicated made the experience feel unwelcoming. A bit more warmth and clarity would‚Äôve gone a long way.

Attention to: Chinese lady, blonde/bleached hair who was being rude to me

text: The experience does deserve a 4-star due to its incredible food and service. I still do believe the place could use a bit of adjustments since the price and salt used in dishes weren‚Äôt the best. Though this is a place we will surely come back to!

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Wei Yuet Wong
text:
May 2025; Updated July 2025
- Walked in on a Friday just before lunchtime and could get a table without waiting.
- Had the Wagyu Burger, Seafood Linguine, with 'Magic' espresso and Barista Breakfast Espresso.
- Especially liked the umami in the Seafood Linguine.
- The coffees were also what was expected.
- Liked the skylight section with ample natural lighting.
- Ordering and payment were self service and convenient through our own mobile phones.

Updated July 2025
- Orange Tonic Espresso is unique and refreshing.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Anum Shahid
text:
Nice clean place. The food was quite good. However the drinks are super expensive, medium quality and small quantity. They should offer soft drinks or sparkling water at least.

Ordered populus scramble which is excellent. Cafe would get 5-star if not for the drinks issue.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Melion Tan
text:
Wanted to eat Blanco Prawn noodle, but it was closed, so I ended up walking up to Apricus to have brunch instead.

Ordered their latte, and it is quite nice with cute latte art. Ordered the pull lamb burger while my wife ordered the seafood aglio olio. The pull lamb burger is ok, while the seafood aglio olio tastes funny.

Compared to the last time we came, i think the restaurant kind of drop in standard for their food and service.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Sabrina & Kamal
text: Got caramel latte and strawberry matcha to go. Caramel latte tasted very diluted and tasted like slightly flavored milk. strawberry matcha did not taste good as well, the puree tasted so sour. and there was an option to change the milk to strawberry milk which was a huge mistake as that made the drink even more convoluted. could barely only drink a third of each drink before we had to throw them away and overall a very disappointing experience as the drinks were quite pricey. hope you change your recipe and at least r&d the drinks before selling them.

title: The Apricus Coffee & Food Co.
name: Andik‚Äôs Family
text:
The AUDACITY of this place!!! First, no proper system for walking in or being seated ‚Äî just people standing around confused. Then after queuing to order for several minutes, we‚Äôre told to go sit and scan a QR code smaller than a 50 cent coin to order?! Absolutely ridiculous. No signs, no clear instructions, just chaos.

The nerve to charge a separate service charge AND GST ‚Äî for what service exactly?! For making us feel lost and frustrated?!

Tried the strawberry matcha and it was gritty. The seeds? from the strawberry compote was still large and bitter.

Terribly managed, zero hospitality.

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: Nicole Ong
text:
I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of food and value. Our family of 3 had the escargots, seafood stew and tenderloin steak.

The escargots were drenched in garlic butter and each bite was a burst of flavour. My 7 year old son who refused to eat escargots became a convert after trying them. The steak was done to medium rare perfection and we enjoyed every bit of it. The seafood stew was good too but we felt the ingredients could be a bit fresher. The steak was definitely my highlight of the night.

I wish they had draft beer instead of bottled beer, but overall we had a great family meal with nostalgic cosy vibes.

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: Sharon Ang
text: Excellent chicken chop, chicken wings and mushroom soup. Nice music and ambience. Cosy.

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: patti0311
text: Food was quite mediocre not like the one at Cantonment Road. We didn't hv a reservation so had to sit outside along the corridor of the building. Staff was in the restaurant so for those of us sitting outside the service was not so good

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: Pei Yun CHENG
text:
Nice and cosy ambuence. Beautiful deco. Delicious food. I had a NZ Stirloin Steak set. It was perfect. Comes with a choice of beverage and a dessert.

A nice place to.celebrate a special occasion, or simply enjoy a comforting meal with family and friends.

This place.has some great lunch deals!

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: Natalie Tay
text:
Used to eat here when it was in Tanjong Pagar! Pleased to find it hidden in Sunset way.

Had dinner here without reservation and was seated outside. I ordered the mushroom soup and tenderloin steak for myself and was very very sated. The mushroom soup isn‚Äôt extremely fancy, but is homey. Steak was fantastic. They do their medium rare correctly üòô The meal is very filling and I would‚Äôve been better off without the soup.

We were seated outside and the heat was manageable with the fans and portable air con. I am prone to mosquito bites and did have two while eating though. Make a reservation!

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: AC Chan
text:
Kicking off the #SG60 celebrations with a taste of the past ‚Äî Hainanese pork chop, just like how I remember it growing up.
It‚Äôs the one dish I always come back to and Mariner‚Äôs Corner gets it spot on. That golden, ultra-crispy crust on the outside, thinly sliced and tender with a blush of pink inside and that classic sweet-tangy ketchup worcestershire sauce! A timeless local dish that brings back all the wonderful memories. Bonus? I got to enjoy this amazing meal using my #SG60vouchers!

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: iamjess
text: Had dinner at this restaurant and enjoyed the cozy atmosphere. Service was decent and food was alright. The salmon steak we had was the highlight‚Äîflavorful, nicely cooked, and tender. A pleasant spot for a casual meal if you‚Äôre nearby.

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: dennis giam
text: This restaurant has a nostalgic style and atmosphere is very nice, I like it very much and the music is not too loud just nice to enjoy it while and chatting with my family. The service staffs are attentive and also very courteous and friendly. The food is great and portion is very generous. I had the chicken chop and lots of source which is how I like it. The salad is also very fresh. I will definitely recommend to try this restaurant when you are in the Clementi area. My family and I had a very good experience having lunch here.

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: Edwin Wong
text: Jice ambience..good service..

name: Master Account
text:

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: Jason Deng
text:
Today‚Äôs introduction is something different, not our normal hawker/coffeeshop food. We have visited mariners‚Äô corner, located at sunset way.

We have ordered a salmon dish and a thermidor prawns with chicken chop set meal. The set meal also comes with a salad, soup of the day, tea/coffee and dessert.

1st look at the dishes, i must say i quite like the color. I have wasted no time digging in to the greens 1st. Not bad. Then i tried the mash potatoe, quite decent too. Put the prawns to the side, attacked the chicken chop. Wow i must say i am impressed by the chop. Nice and soft. Sauce is really good. Just take note not to wait too long to eat it. Because it taste nice when it‚Äôs warm, thereafter when it goes cold, it gets pretty tough.

Salmon is pretty tough to begin with. Personally i didn‚Äôt really liked it. Especially when the price is not cheap. Makes me rethink why did we order this dish. Maybe we should have ordered something else. I hope my honest feedback can make you decide which dish to order.

The prawns are not too bad. Not the best ever but decent.

Can go and try if you are near that area. Try the chicken chop üôÇ

Location : 106 clementi street 12. #01-40Ôøº

#chickenchop
#Thermidor
#westernfood

text: Amazing food, we got the pork chops, grilled lamb chops, BBQ pork ribs and the N.Z ribeye with sausage, all of which were cooked really nicely! The ribs were so tender it was just falling off the bones üòÆ‚Äçüí® great service crew also, tending to us promptly and catering to our needs! A solid 9/10 for meat lovers. Great portion, satisfying flavours, and comforting all around. Would definitely come back for this after a long day or when you‚Äôre just craving something hearty and indulgent.

title: Mariners' Corner Restaurant
name: cy ËÉ° (Spring swallow)
text:
Came here for lunch on 11/5/25 (Sun) for lunch without reservation. Happened to be a busy day island-wide as most families are celebrating Mother's Day.

Offered seating alfresco (with shelter from sun/rain). Ox tail stew was nice without overpowering spices. The buttered vegetables a tad bland, may be to better complement the stew.

Topped up $5.80 to 1 order to complete the meal with garlic bread (2 slices), a soup, a salad, a cake for dessert and hot coffee/tea.

The salad was a little lacklustre, in part due to the unusual colour of the dressing. Opined that the ox tail stew as a meal is sufficient unless you are a big eater. Can forgo the soup ü§∑

title: Prime Supermarket
name: qi Feng
text:
Used to shop here as it is near, but the price is outrageous sometimes. And now, some items require you to take a photo of the barcode to get an additional discount, You have to show it to the cashier, OTHERWISE YOU WILL BE PAYING EXTRA.

My mum has forgotten about it sometimes because it requires 3 4 photo taking of the barcode. It‚Äôs ridiculous.

It shouldn't be the customer's job to take a photo of the barcode just to get a discount.
It‚Äôs an outrageously outdated method. Clearly shows the company is sleeping and being lazy.

During the digital migration, it was handled poorly, resulting in some loss of points. It appeared suddenly and there weren‚Äôt any plans to push out this migration progressively.

Out of nowhere. A manual membership card wasn‚Äôt accepted. You have to download their crappy app (that hang and couldn‚Äôt even load properly, doing it at the cashier will just hold up the queue).
You are serving the senior generation. You shouldn't expect the elderly to understand so quickly to migrate their membership digitally or take a photo of the barcode to get an additional discount.

Really poor quality of service and poor management to make customers' lives easier.

name: Ht L.
text:
Updated review after clinic‚Äôs detailed explanation:
This clinic doesn‚Äôt offer subsidised vaccination pricing as per MOH subsidised rate guidelines despite booking via MOH site, so it‚Äôs definitely pricier than normal. Based on clinic‚Äôs explanation, only selected clinics may offer subsidised vaccination, and some may charge consultation fees. Maximum price for flu vaccine per MOH guidelines is $70 (based on clinic‚Äôs explanation) and that was what was charged & paid. Do check before heading over as we‚Äôve had to pay almost 2x the price compared to other clinic. Other clinic only charged my family member $38 btw.

MAJOR REGRET not checking.

Update after seeing Dr Tang‚Äôs reply:
We did show Green CHAS card to the staff, but was still told there‚Äôs no subsidy at all (only CHAS chronic card is entitled for discount) even though MOH and Vaccine.gov.sg states that with Green CHAS card will be $35. We also booked the flu vaccine appointment via MOH‚Äôs website click through, assuming it‚Äôll direct us to clinics under the same pricing scheme but had a rude shock when a nearby clinic from home charged my other family member $38.15 while this clinic charged us $70. Not sure where the discrepancies are or if this clinic just doesn‚Äôt offer subsidised rates per MOH‚Äôs guidelines. Still unsatisfied as we did not get any clear explanation as to why there are price differences. The staff only mentioned ‚Äúthis is our clinic pricing, only CHAS chronic is entitled to staff discount‚Äù.

title: Jurong West ActiveSG Sports Hall
name: Sri Janakiraman
text:
Jurong West ActiveSG Sports Complex is a gem in the heart of Singapore's western region. Perfectly equipped to cater to a wide range of fitness and recreational needs, it offers a welcoming environment for people of all ages and fitness levels.

One of the highlights of this sports complex is its state-of-the-art swimming pool. With clean and well-maintained facilities, including a kids‚Äô pool, lap pool, and a wading pool, it‚Äôs a haven for swimmers and families looking for a refreshing day out. The lifeguards are attentive, ensuring safety for all.

Fitness enthusiasts will appreciate the well-equipped gym, featuring modern machines and spacious workout areas. The atmosphere is conducive to achieving fitness goals, with friendly staff always ready to assist. Additionally, the complex offers a variety of group classes such as yoga, Zumba, and aqua aerobics, catering to a wide range of interests.

The sports halls are another standout feature, accommodating sports like badminton, basketball, and table tennis. These facilities are well-maintained and ideal for friendly games or competitive events. The running tracks and outdoor spaces further enhance the appeal of the complex.

Accessibility is another advantage, with ample parking and proximity to public transport. The affordable entry fees and ActiveSG credits make it a cost-effective option for families and individuals alike.

Overall, Jurong West ActiveSG Sports Complex combines excellent facilities with a vibrant community atmosphere, making it a top choice for sports and recreation in Singapore. A visit here is always a rewarding experience!

title: BFT Pioneer
name: Samurai
text:
Most BFT studios in Singapore that I‚Äôve visited aren‚Äôt as spacious as BFT Pioneer. If you‚Äôre looking to level up your fitness journey, this is the place to be. The coaches are genuinely caring and always make sure your form is on point for safe and effective training.

It‚Äôs also an ideal space for HYROX training with a long stretch of turf perfect for sled pushes and pulls, plus a wide area for farmer‚Äôs carries and burpee broad jumps. Everything you need to prep for race day is right here!

title: BFT Pioneer
name: JamesPJ
text: This is a great outlet, large, clean and well maintained. The coaches are friendly and supportive - with their encouragement, during my 8 week challenge, I lost 6% body fat and increased lean mass 4.5%. I have recommended to friends and family. In general, BFT is quite expensive but I feel the results justify the price. The programme is varied enough that you can go every day.

title: BFT Pioneer

title: BFT Pioneer
name: WY C
text:
A truly fantastic training experience at BFT Pioneer!

The sessions are structured, dynamic, and well-balanced throughout the week. The gym environment is consistently clean and spacious, with particular mention to the well-maintained toilets and changing rooms. Equipment is in excellent condition and always ready for use.

What really stands out are the coaches‚Äîespecially Coach Leo. He‚Äôs not only professional and knowledgeable, but also incredibly attentive. He‚Äôs quick to pick up on members‚Äô moods, fatigue levels, and training progress. His thoughtful guidance and timely suggestions often feel like personal coaching‚Äîeven in a group setting.

Since joining, I‚Äôve seen great improvements in my fitness, posture, and overall training approach. I‚Äôve learned how to train safely and effectively with proper techniques, thanks to the support of the BFT Pioneer team.

Highly recommended for anyone serious about their fitness journey!

Highly recommend anyone considering joining this community, whether you're a fitness newbie or an enthusiast who is looking to workout with a group of likeminded community!

title: Fernvale Hawker Centre & Market
name: Wei Yuet Wong
text:
July 2023: Updated July 2025
- Spacious, well ventilated (high ceiling and giant fans), mid-sized hawker center.
- Has a small wet market section with about a dozen stalls.
- Run by the Kopitiam Group.
- Can pay using PayNow/PayLah! QR, cash (getting uncommon), CDC vouchers or the NTUC app. Best using the NTUC app as you get a 10% discount.
- Stalls are not as many as the larger hawker centers, but I think there is enough variety for everyone.
- The biggest plus point is it's clean. The cleaning staff work rather efficiently to clean the floors and the tables. The dirty plates are also moved to the closed washing bay quickly.
- As a result, rarely see birds or pigeons and the hawker center is not littered with bird droppings.
- Most people return their plates and trays, but as always there are some who do not do their part (including. dirty wash basins, and toilets)...
- Kudos to the cleaning crew!

text: Great community, great energy in the class with experience trainer, beginner friendly all fitness level are welcome to join, the club is spacious too. THUMBS UP üëçüèª
